Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/image6.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Aposto que voc\xea n\xe3o esperou viver o suficiente para ver este dia, certo? Quem diria\u2026 Aplica\xe7\xf5es Linux rodando no Windows, tal como as aplica\xe7\xf5es Windows que rodam no Linux com o WINE? Pois \xe9, esse dia chegou. Bem, ainda n\xe3o completamente, mas j\xe1 estamos quase l\xe1. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Alegre" /> <!--more-->A Microsoft pegou o mundo de surpresa no <a href="http://build.microsoft.com/" target="_blank">Build 2016</a> ao anunciar o <strong>Bash on Windows</strong>, resultado de uma parceria com a Canonical e que resultou na possibilidade de rodar partes do Linux (a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_space" target="_blank"><em>userland</em></a>, para ser mais preciso) sobre o Windows atrav\xe9s de uma camada de tradu\xe7\xe3o de <em>syscalls</em> (chamadas ao kernel Linux), tal como o projeto WINE faz tradu\xe7\xe3o de chamadas Win32 para permitir a execu\xe7\xe3o de aplicativos desktop Windows no Linux. Esse \u201cWINE\u201d da Microsoft \xe9 o Windows Subsystem for Linux, mostrado abaixo: <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Arquitetura do Bash on Windows" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-5.png" alt="Arquitetura do Bash on Windows" width="865" height="845" border="0" /> <figcaption>Arquitetura do Bash on Windows.</figcaption></figure>Entretanto, o Bash on Windows suporta apenas aplica\xe7\xf5es de linha de comando. Em tese, aplicativos gr\xe1ficos n\xe3o poderiam ser executados no Windows atrav\xe9s do Bash. <blockquote>Mas por que n\xe3o?</blockquote> Se voc\xea \xe9 como eu, ent\xe3o n\xe3o aceita um \u201cn\xe3o\u201d como resposta. Pelo menos, n\xe3o sem luta! <h2><em>Back to basics</em> \u2013 aplicativos GUI no Linux</h2> A interface gr\xe1fica do Linux \xe9 baseada numa tecnologia chamada de <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X_Window_System" target="_blank">X Window System</a> (mais comumente chamada de X11). O X11 divide as aplica\xe7\xf5es entre <em>X Clients</em> (s\xe3o as aplica\xe7\xf5es gr\xe1ficas propriamente ditas, como o Firefox ou Gimp) e o <em>X Server</em> (componente que gerencia o hardware gr\xe1fico e faz a exibi\xe7\xe3o de imagens). O Bash on Windows n\xe3o tem como exibir aplicativos gr\xe1ficos pelo simples motivo de que n\xe3o h\xe1 um X Server rodando. Como o foco da Microsoft com o Bash \xe9 suportar a interface de linha de comando (CLI, \u201c<em>command-line interface</em>\u201d), n\xe3o faz sentido oferecer um componente de suporte a aplica\xe7\xf5es gr\xe1ficas (GUI, \u201c<em>graphical user interface</em>\u201d). Agora, e se tiv\xe9ssemos um X Server rodando no Windows? Ser\xe1 que funcionaria? Bem, \u2018bora testar! <h2>Instalando o Bash on Windows</h2> Para nosso teste, precisamos do Bash on Windows. Na data em que este post foi escrito, ele estava dispon\xedvel apenas para Windows Insiders no <em>Fast Ring</em> (Windows 10 Insider Preview, build 14316 ou posterior). Com a vers\xe3o correta do Windows, basta abrir o prompt de comando do Windows (CMD) e digitar <code>bash</code>: <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Instalando o Bash on Windows no Windows 10 Insider Preview" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-6.png" alt="Instalando o Bash on Windows no Windows 10 Insider Preview" width="654" height="434" border="0" /><figcaption>Instalando o Bash on Windows no Windows 10 Insider Preview</figcaption></figure> <h2>X Server no Windows</h2> O primeiro desafio \xe9 arrumar um X Server. N\xe3o d\xe1 para pegar um do Linux \u2013 como o servidor X interage com dispositivos gr\xe1ficos, ele precisa de acesso de baixo n\xedvel. Portanto, precisa ser escrito especialmente para Windows. Precisamos, assim, de um <em>port</em> do X Server para Windows. Para nosso teste, usei o <a href="https://sourceforge.net/projects/xming/" target="_blank">Xming X Server</a>. Baixe-o e o instale no seu computador. <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Xming rodando na bandeja de sistema do Windows" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-8.png" alt="Xming rodando na bandeja de sistema do Windows" width="731" height="427" border="0" /><figcaption>Xming rodando na bandeja de sistema do Windows</figcaption></figure> <h2>Hora da verdade</h2> Inicie o Xming a partir do Menu Iniciar para termos nosso servidor X rodando. Agora, abra o Bash a partir do Menu Iniciar. Para nosso teste iremos instalar o famoso <a href="https://www.gimp.org/" target="_blank">Gimp</a>. \xc9 s\xf3 ir na linha de comando do bash e digitar <code>apt install gimp</code>: <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Instalando o gimp no Bash on Windows" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png" alt="Instalando o gimp no Bash on Windows" width="1708" height="1078" border="0" /><figcaption>Instalando o gimp no Bash on Windows.</figcaption></figure>Como o Bash on Windows n\xe3o sabe que agora temos um servidor X rodando, precisamos informar isso na linha de comando. Digite o comando <strong><code>DISPLAY=:0 gimp</code></strong> para iniciar o Gimp no Windows: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows-1.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Gimp rodando no Windows 10 (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png" alt="Gimp rodando no Windows 10" width="644" height="364" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Gimp rodando no Windows 10 (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure> <h2>Conclus\xe3o</h2> Este post foi apenas para matar a curiosidade de saber se seria poss\xedvel rodar aplica\xe7\xf5es Linux no Windows. A resposta inicial \xe9 um surpreendente e animador \u201c<strong>sim!</strong>\u201d, mas a verdade \xe9 mais complexa que isso. Primeiramente \xe9 importante destacar que as aplica\xe7\xf5es, neste instante, est\xe3o inst\xe1veis e travam o tempo todo. \xc9 praticamente imposs\xedvel usar o Gimp neste momento. Mas isso era esperado, afinal o Windows Subsystem for Linux (WS4L) ainda n\xe3o est\xe1 pronto. Como o foco da Microsoft \xe9 a linha de comando, provavelmente h\xe1 recursos de kernel necess\xe1rios para aplica\xe7\xf5es X que ainda n\xe3o est\xe3o dispon\xedveis no WS4L. Ali\xe1s, pode ser que nunca venham a estar dispon\xedveis. Mas o simples fato de j\xe1 ser poss\xedvel executar aplica\xe7\xf5es Linux GUI no Windows 10 \xe9 algo que seria inimagin\xe1vel h\xe1 alguns poucos dias atr\xe1s. Quem sabe o que o futuro nos reserva? Minha sugest\xe3o: Experimente com outras aplica\xe7\xf5es. Pode ser que umas sejam mais est\xe1veis que outras. Tem gente que conseguiu rodar VIM e Firefox. D\xea uma olhada <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/Windows10/comments/4ea4w4/fyi_you_can_run_gui_linux_apps_from_bash/" target="_blank">nesta thread no Reddit</a>, onde as pessoas est\xe3o trocando dicas e truques a respeito deste assunto. E voc\xea, o que acha deste admir\xe1vel mundo novo? Compartilhe sua experi\xeancia nos coment\xe1rios! &nbsp; Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-6.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-8.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/04/12/execute-aplicacoes-gui-linux-no-windows-10/', 'date': u'2016-04-12 19:20:28', 'slug': u'execute-aplicacoes-gui-linux-no-windows-10', 'title': u'Execute aplica\xe7\xf5es GUI Linux no Windows 10', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Dicas'], u'post_translations': [u'3b48e3b7-8156-42af-b817-07964a5236fb'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'Bash on Windows', u'Windows 10']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'12081', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-04/execute-aplicacoes-gui-linux-no-windows-10/2016-04-12-Post.md
URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-5.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-5.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-6.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-6.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-8.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-8.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'I bet you didn&#39;t expect to live long enough to see this day, right? Who would have thought ... Linux applications running on Windows, such as Windows applications that run on Linux with WINE? Well, that day has come. Well, not quite yet, but we&#39;re almost there. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Alegre" /> <!--more-->Microsoft took the world by surprise i<a href="http://build.microsoft.com/" target="_blank">n Build 2</a>016 by announc<strong>ing the Bash o</strong>n Windows, the result of a partnership with Canonical and which resulted in the possibility to ru<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_space" target="_blank"><em>n parts</em></a> of the Linux (userland, to be precise) on Windows through a translation <em>layer o</em>f syscalls (calls to the Linux kernel), such as design WINE makes translation of Win32 calls to allow Windows desktop application on Linux. This &quot;WINE&quot; from Microsoft is Windows Subsystem for Linux, shown below: <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Bash architecture on Windows" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-5.png" alt="Bash architecture on Windows" width="865" height="845" border="0" /> <figcaption>Bash on Windows architecture.</figcaption></figure>However, the Bash on Windows only supports command-line applications. In theory, graphics applications cannot be run in Windows through the Bash. <blockquote>But why not?</blockquote> If you&#39;re like me, then don&#39;t take no for an answer. At least, not without a fight! <h2><em>Back to basic</em>s-GUI applications on Linux</h2> The graphical interface of Linux is based on a technology c<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X_Window_System" target="_blank">alled X Windo</a>w System (commonly X 11 call). X 11 divides the applications bet<em>ween X Cl</em>ients (are the graphics applications, such as Firefox or Gimp) and the X Serv<em>er (comp</em>onent that manages the graphics hardware and makes the display of images). Bash on Windows has no way to display graphics applications for the simple reason that there is an X Server running. As the focus of Microsoft with the Bash is to support the command-line interface (CL<em>I, &quot;command-line&quot; inte</em>rface), it makes no sense to offer a support graphic applications component (GUI &quot;<em>graphical user interface</em>&quot;). Now, what if we had an X Server running on Windows? Will that work? Well, let&#39;s try it! <h2>Installing Bash on Windows</h2> For our test, we need the Bash on Windows. At the time this post was written, he was only available for Windows Insiders in Fa<em>st Ring </em>(10 Insider Preview Windows, build 14316 or later). With the correct version of Windows, simply open the Windows command prompt (CMD) and type in<code> bas</code>h: <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Installing Bash on Windows on Windows 10 Insider Preview" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-6.png" alt="Installing Bash on Windows on Windows 10 Insider Preview" width="654" height="434" border="0" /><figcaption>Installing Bash on Windows on Windows 10 Insider Preview</figcaption></figure> <h2>X Server on Windows</h2> The first challenge is to get an X Server. You can&#39;t get a Linux-like the X Server interacts with graphics devices, he needs low-level access. Therefore, needs to be written especially for Windows. We need, therefore, a por<em>t of</em> the X Server for Windows. For our test, I used the <a href="https://sourceforge.net/projects/xming/" target="_blank">Xming X Server</a>. Download it and install it on your computer. <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Xming running in your Windows system tray" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-8.png" alt="Xming running in your Windows system tray" width="731" height="427" border="0" /><figcaption>Xming running in your Windows system tray</figcaption></figure> <h2>Moment of truth</h2> Start Xming from the Start Menu for terms our X server running. Now, open the Bash from the Start Menu. For our test we will install the famous <a href="https://www.gimp.org/" target="_blank">Gimp</a>. Just go to the command line of bash and type <code>apt install gimp</code>: <figure><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Installing gimp under Bash on Windows" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png" alt="Installing gimp under Bash on Windows" width="1708" height="1078" border="0" /><figcaption>Installing gimp under Bash on Windows.</figcaption></figure>As the Bash on Windows doesn&#39;t know that we now have an X server running, we need to inform it on the command line. Type the comman<strong><code>d DISPLAY =: 0 </code></strong>gimp to start Gimp on Windows: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows-1.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="GIMP running on Windows 10 (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png" alt="GIMP running on Windows 10" width="644" height="364" border="0" /></a><figcaption>GIMP running on Windows 10 (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure> <h2>Conclusion</h2> This post was just to kill the curiosity to know if it would be possible to run Linux applications on Windows. The answer is a surprising and heartening &quot;Yes<strong>!&quot;, </strong>but the truth is more complex than that. First it is important to highlight that, right now, are unstable and lock all the time. It is virtually impossible to use the Gimp in this moment. But that&#39;s to be expected, after all the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WS4L) is not ready yet. As the focus of Microsoft&#39;s command line, probably there are kernel features required for X applications that are not yet available in the WS4L. In fact, it may never be available. But the simple fact of being possible to run Linux GUI applications on Windows 10 is something that would be unimaginable a few days ago. Who knows what the future holds? My suggestion: try with other applications. It may be that some are more stable than others. Some people managed to turn CAME and Firefox. Take a look a<a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/Windows10/comments/4ea4w4/fyi_you_can_run_gui_linux_apps_from_bash/" target="_blank">t this thread on Red</a>dit, where people are swapping tips and tricks regarding this subject. And you, what do you think of this brave new world? Share your experience in the comments! A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-6.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-8.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/04/12/run-applications-gui-linux-on-windows-10/', 'date': u'2016-04-12 19:20:28', 'slug': u'run-applications-gui-linux-on-windows-10', 'title': u'Run Linux on Windows GUI applications 10', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Tips'], u'post_translations': [u'3b48e3b7-8156-42af-b817-07964a5236fb'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'12311', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-7.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Gimp_On_Windows_thumb-1.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'<p>Um cen\xe1rio t\xedpico para usu\xe1rios do VSTS (<a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/visual-studio-team-services-vs.aspx" target="_blank">Visual Studio Team Services</a>, antigo Visual Studio Online) \xe9 precisar liberar acesso a usu\xe1rios externos. Por exemplo, uma empresa que contrata fornecedores para desenvolvimento terceirizado de software precisa conceder acesso aos times do fornecedor que atuar\xe3o nos projetos armazenados em seu VSTS.</p> <p>O VSTS permite que esse problema seja resolvido das mais diferentes maneiras, que variam de acordo com a facilidade de implementa\xe7\xe3o e a conveni\xeancia no uso. Venha ver neste post como habilitar esse cen\xe1rio em sua conta do VSTS.</p><!--more--><p>Como comentei acima, o VSTS \xe9 extremamente flex\xedvel em termos de modelo de autentica\xe7\xe3o. Isso significa que h\xe1 v\xe1rias formas de resolver o acesso de usu\xe1rios externos (pessoas de fora de sua empresa) \xe0 sua conta corporativa do VSTS. Neste post vou discutir algumas das abordagens poss\xedveis:</p> <ol> <li><a href="#cen1">Cen\xe1rio b\xe1sico: Usu\xe1rios MSA</a> <li><a href="#cen2">Cen\xe1rio intermedi\xe1rio: Azure AD simples, sem SSO</a> <li><a href="#cen3" target="_blank">Cen\xe1rio avan\xe7ado: Azure AD federado, com SSO</a></li></ol> <p>Para cada um desses cen\xe1rios, vamos assumir a exist\xeancia de duas entidades:</p> <ul> <li><strong>O cliente</strong>: Nosso cliente \xe9 a empresa fict\xedcia \u201cCliente Demo L3\u201d. A conta de VSTS \xe9 <strong>clientedemol3.visualstudio.com</strong> e seu dom\xednio Azure AD \xe9 o <strong>clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com</strong>. Nosso cliente tem um usu\xe1rio \u201c<em>admin</em>\u201d respons\xe1vel pela administra\xe7\xe3o do dom\xednio AAD e da conta VSTS. Seu e-mail \xe9 <strong><a href="mailto:admin@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com">admin@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com</a></strong>. Esse mesmo usu\xe1rio tem uma Microsoft Account particular associada ao e-mail <a href="mailto:adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com">adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com</a>. <li><strong>O fornecedor</strong>: O fornecedor ser\xe1 a Lambda3, claro <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Alegre" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png">. O dom\xednio Azure AD da Lambda3, em nosso exemplo, \xe9 o <strong>lambda3.com.br</strong>. J\xe1 o usu\xe1rio da Lambda3 serei eu mesmo (Igor Abade), com o e-mail <a href="mailto:igor.abade[arroba]lambda3.com.br" target="_blank">igor.abade[arroba]lambda3.com.br</a>.</li></ul> <p>Mas afinal o que vamos ver? Quero mostrar como a empresa <strong>Cliente Demo L3</strong> poderia dar acesso a um usu\xe1rio externo \u2013 no nosso exemplo, eu \u2013 para que ele pudesse atuar em um projeto no seu VSTS <strong>clientedemol3.visualstudio.com</strong>. Como voc\xea pode imaginar, esse \xe9 um cen\xe1rio bastante comum para n\xf3s, j\xe1 que nossos desenvolvedores e/ou consultores ALM precisam acessar as contas VSTS de nossos clientes sempre que participamos de algum projeto.</p> <h2><a name="cen1"></a>Cen\xe1rio b\xe1sico: Usu\xe1rios MSA</h2> <p>O primeiro cen\xe1rio considera um cliente que, por algum motivo, escolha n\xe3o utilizar um dom\xednio Azure AD integrado ao VSTS para gerenciar as identidades de seus desenvolvedores. Esse \xe9 o cen\xe1rio mais simples de todos, j\xe1 que depende apenas da conta VSTS. A bem da verdade, quando o VSTS foi lan\xe7ado (quando ainda se chamava VSO), esse era o \xfanico cen\xe1rio poss\xedvel. O suporte a AAD veio s\xf3 depois.</p> <p>Quando n\xe3o h\xe1 um diret\xf3rio AAD associado a uma conta VSTS, as identidades <strong>precisam</strong> ser Contas Microsoft (\u201c<em><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/account" target="_blank">Microsoft Account</a></em>\u201d ou MSA). Significa que qualquer pessoa que queira acessar nossa conta fict\xedcia clientedemol3.visualstudio.com precisa, primeiramente, criar uma Conta Microsoft em <a href="https://account.microsoft.com" target="_blank">account.microsoft.com</a>. Nos prim\xf3rdios do <strike>VSO</strike> VSTS era assim que a gente fazia aqui na Lambda3:</p> <ul> <li>Criava uma Conta Microsoft com o e-mail da Lambda3 (neste caso, igor.abade[arroba]lambda3.com.br); <li>Adicionava (\u201cconvidava\u201d) o usu\xe1rio/e-mail na conta VSTS do cliente (clientedemol3.visualstudio.com); <li>Quando eu quisesse acessar a conta do cliente, faria o login com minha MSA.</li></ul> <p align="center"><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-10.png"><img title="Adicionando uma Conta Microsoft ao VSTS do Cliente Demo L3 (clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Adicionando uma Conta Microsoft ao VSTS do Cliente Demo L3" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-2.png" width="644" height="298"></a><figcaption>Adicionando uma Conta Microsoft ao VSTS do Cliente Demo L3 (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Apesar de bastante simples, esse modelo tem alguns problemas:</p> <ol> <li><strong>Duas identidades diferentes</strong>. Apesar de eu ter uma Microsoft Account com um nome de usu\xe1rio id\xeantico \xe0quele que uso no dom\xednio interno da Lambda3, eles s\xe3o na verdade duas coisas distintas. Por isso eu precisava manter dois conjuntos de credenciais, gerenciando duas senhas em dois sistemas completamente diferentes. Isso nos leva ao segundo problema, que \xe9\u2026 <li><strong>Falta de \u201c<em>single sign-on</em>\u201d</strong>. Como s\xe3o duas contas diferentes, estar autenticado no dom\xednio da Lambda3 n\xe3o bastava. Eu precisava me autenticar mais uma vez quando quisesse acessar a conta VSTS do cliente. Al\xe9m disso, a conta MSA pertence a mim, n\xe3o \xe0 empresa. Com isso, n\xe3o \xe9 poss\xedvel fazer nenhum tipo de gest\xe3o corporativa desse usu\xe1rio. Coisas \xf3bvias, como bloquear um usu\xe1rio quando ele se desliga da empresa, s\xe3o imposs\xedveis quando se usa contas MSA. Por fim\u2026 <li><strong>Identidade pessoal (n\xe3o-corporativa)</strong>. Como dissemos, as MSA pertencem aos indiv\xedduos que as criaram e n\xe3o \xe0s empresas. Dessa forma, n\xe3o h\xe1 absolutamente nenhum controle corporativo (como pol\xedtica de senhas ou bloqueio de contas) que possa ser feito por TI.</li></ol> <p>Obviamente esse modelo n\xe3o \xe9 o ideal para uma empresa e, por isso, a Microsoft estendeu o servi\xe7o para oferecer uma solu\xe7\xe3o de n\xedvel corporativo para acesso ao VSTS \u2013 a integra\xe7\xe3o com o AAD.</p> <h2><a name="cen2"></a>Cen\xe1rio intermedi\xe1rio: Azure AD simples, sem SSO</h2> <p>Clientes que utilizam o Azure AD integrado ao VSTS (veja como integrar os dois <font style="background-color: #ffff00"></font><a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/get-started/setup/manage-organization-access-for-your-account-vs" target="_blank">aqui</a><font style="background-color: #ffff00"></font>) n\xe3o dependem mais de Contas Microsoft para dar acesso \xe0 sua conta do VS Team Services. Ao inv\xe9s disso, eles usam contas do seu dom\xednio na nuvem. O benef\xedcio mais importante disso \xe9 que a gest\xe3o de identidades deixa de ser distribu\xedda (como acontece com as Contas MSA, onde cada usu\xe1rio cria e cuida da sua pr\xf3pria conta) e passa a ser centralizada (a cria\xe7\xe3o e gest\xe3o de usu\xe1rio \xe9 feita pelo administrador do dom\xednio AAD). Ali\xe1s, muitas empresas s\xf3 passaram a considerar o uso do VSTS depois do suporte a AAD por conta de sua necessidade de gerenciar identidades e acessos de maneira mais \u201ccorporativa\u201d.</p> <p>Quando o Azure AD entra na equa\xe7\xe3o, tudo muda. O controle de identidades deixa de ser feito no VSTS e passa para o diret\xf3rio no Azure. A primeira consequ\xeancia disso \xe9 que voc\xea n\xe3o tem mais a op\xe7\xe3o de continuar simplesmente adicionando Contas Microsoft ao VSTS. Todas as contas precisam, necessariamente, vir do diret\xf3rio.</p> <p>Essa premissa \u2013 \u201c<em>todas as contas devem vir do diret\xf3rio</em>\u201d \u2013 nos deixa com duas op\xe7\xf5es:</p> <ol> <li>Continuar usando Contas Microsoft (MSA); <li>Criar usu\xe1rios locais no dom\xednio.</li></ol> <h3>Continuar usando Contas Microsoft (MSA)</h3> <p>\u201cHein?\u201d, voc\xea deve estar se perguntando. \u201cMas ele n\xe3o acabou de falar que n\xe3o d\xe1 mais para usar contas MSA?\u201c</p> <p>Bem, o que eu disse \xe9 que n\xe3o d\xe1 para \u201csimplesmente\u201d adicionar contas MSA. Mas com um pouco de complica\xe7\xe3o, tudo se resolve. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Alegre" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png"></p> <p>O que muda \xe9 que, <strong>antes</strong> de adicionar uma conta MSA ao VSTS precisamos primeiro adiciona-la ao dom\xednio AAD. Ou seja, apenas um passo a mais e o processo continua igual ao que vimos acima.</p> <p>Acesse o <a href="https://manage.windowsazure.com/" target="_blank">Portal Cl\xe1ssico do Azure</a> e v\xe1 para a p\xe1gina de administra\xe7\xe3o do seu diret\xf3rio. Na aba <strong>Users</strong> iremos incluir o acesso a uma conta MSA ao dom\xednio:</p> <p align="center"><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-11.png"><img title="Para adicionar um usu&aacute;rio MSA ao AAD acesse o Portal Cl&aacute;ssico do Azure e indique o tipo de usu&aacute;rio (1) e o email da conta MSA (2) (clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Para adicionar um usu&aacute;rio MSA ao AAD acesse o Portal Cl&aacute;ssico do Azure e indique o tipo de usu&aacute;rio (1) e o email da conta MSA (2)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-3.png" width="484" height="407"></a><figcaption>Para adicionar um usu\xe1rio MSA ao AAD acesse o Portal Cl\xe1ssico do Azure e indique o tipo de usu\xe1rio (1) e o e-mail da conta MSA (2) (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p><a name="cen3"></a></p> <p>Uma vez adicionado o usu\xe1rio ao AAD, agora \xe9 s\xf3 ir na tela de usu\xe1rios do VSTS e adicionar o usu\xe1rio normalmente. Ele ser\xe1 listado como se fizesse parte do dom\xednio do AAD.</p> <h3>Criar usu\xe1rios locais no dom\xednio</h3> <p>Uma op\xe7\xe3o melhor, para n\xe3o precisar depender de Contas MSA, \xe9 criar contas locais no Azure AD. Assim, a responsabilidade de criar os acessos deixa de ser do desenvolvedor no fornecedor e passa a ser do cliente \u2013 que, com isso, ret\xe9m controle sobre essa identidade.</p> <p>Voltando ao nosso exemplo: Ao inv\xe9s de eu criar uma conta MSA com meu e-mail da Lambda3, meu cliente criaria um usu\xe1rio para mim (<strong><a href="mailto:igor.abade_lambda3@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com">igor.abade_lambda3@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com</a></strong>) no dom\xednio dele:</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-13.png"><img title="Crie um novo usu&aacute;rio no AAD. Um padr&atilde;o comum &eacute; colocar o nome do usu&aacute;rio e o nome da empresa (clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Crie um novo usu&aacute;rio no AAD. Um padr&atilde;o comum &eacute; colocar o nome do usu&aacute;rio e o nome da empresa" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-5.png" width="484" height="417"></a><figcaption>Crie um novo usu\xe1rio no AAD. Um padr\xe3o comum \xe9 colocar o nome do usu\xe1rio e o nome da empresa (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Para criar um usu\xe1rio no Azure AD \xe9 preciso informar tamb\xe9m seu nome amig\xe1vel e seu papel:</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-14.png"><img title="Detalhes do novo usu&aacute;rio. Dica: N&atilde;o se esque&ccedil;a de identificar a empresa (1), o papel - que deve ser User (2) e, opcionalmente, o suporte a autentica&ccedil;&atilde;o multi-fator (3) (Clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Detalhes do novo usu&aacute;rio. Dica: N&atilde;o se esque&ccedil;a de identificar a empresa (1), o papel - que deve ser User (2) e, opcionalmente, o suporte a autentica&ccedil;&atilde;o multi-fator (3)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-6.png" width="484" height="390"></a><figcaption>Detalhes do novo usu\xe1rio. Dica: N\xe3o se esque\xe7a de identificar a empresa (1), o papel - que deve ser User (2) e, opcionalmente, o suporte a autentica\xe7\xe3o multi-fator (3) (Clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>De novo (j\xe1 estamos ficando craques!): Uma vez adicionado o usu\xe1rio ao AAD, agora \xe9 s\xf3 ir na tela de usu\xe1rios do VSTS e adicionar o usu\xe1rio normalmente. </p> <h2>Cen\xe1rio avan\xe7ado: Azure AD federado, com SSO</h2> <p>Este \xe9, de longe, o cen\xe1rio mais legal. Ali\xe1s, este \xe9 exatamente o cen\xe1rio que temos com alguns de nossos mais importantes clientes. N\xe3o s\xf3 o VSTS do cliente est\xe1 integrada ao Azure AD, mas ele est\xe1 integrado tamb\xe9m ao <strong>nosso</strong> Azure AD. Com isso al\xe9m de todos os benef\xedcios de seguran\xe7a e gerenciamento que o Azure Active Directory oferece, temos acesso a algo bem legal: <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn441213.aspx" target="_blank"><em>single sign-on</em> via ADFS</a>.</p> <p>Quando usamos acesso federado no Azure AD, posso me conectar a todos os servi\xe7os <em>AAD-backed</em> (tais como VSTS, Office 365, Dynamics CRM, Yammer e outros) usando minhas credenciais do dom\xednio AD interno (<em>on-premises</em>) da Lambda3. Com a configura\xe7\xe3o correta no browser, n\xe3o preciso digitar usu\xe1rio e senha para acessar qualquer desses servi\xe7os. <em>Autentica\xe7\xe3o Integrada do Windows #ftw, baby</em>!</p> <p>O princ\xedpio b\xe1sico \xe9: estabelece-se uma rela\xe7\xe3o de confian\xe7a entre os dom\xednios AAD do cliente e do fornecedor, de modo que o administrador de usu\xe1rios no dom\xednio do cliente possa adicionar usu\xe1rios que perten\xe7am ao dom\xednio do fornecedor.</p> <p>Essa rela\xe7\xe3o de confian\xe7a, por\xe9m, \xe9 diferente daquilo que administradores de rede est\xe3o acostumados a ver quando falamos de dom\xednios AD. No Azure AD, tratamos isso de duas formas diferentes:</p> <ol> <li>Usu\xe1rio comum nos dois dom\xednios <li>Convites Azure Active Directory B2B</li></ol> <h3>Usu\xe1rio comum nos dois dom\xednios</h3> <p>At\xe9 bem pouco tempo atr\xe1s esta era a \xfanica forma de estabelecer uma rela\xe7\xe3o de confian\xe7a entre dois dom\xednios AAD a fim de adicionar usu\xe1rios de um dom\xednio A noutro dom\xednio B: ambos precisariam ter um usu\xe1rio comum X que fosse administrador de usu\xe1rios no dom\xednio B.</p> <p>Em outras palavras: Para adicionar no diret\xf3rio `clientedemol3` um usu\xe1rio vindo do dom\xednio `lambda3`, \xe9 preciso que o administrador do diret\xf3rio clientedemol3 seja membro do diret\xf3rio lambda3. \xc9 o ato de adicionar o admin de clientedemol3 no diret\xf3rio lambda3 que estabelece a rela\xe7\xe3o de confian\xe7a \u2013 apenas isso, mais nada \xe9 necess\xe1rio. D\xe1 para deduzir, entretanto, que com isso acabamos num dilema de \u201covo ou galinha\u201d, j\xe1 que um diret\xf3rio depende do outro. Por isso, no princ\xedpio dependemos de uma terceira entidade que seja confi\xe1vel tanto para o diret\xf3rio clientedemol3 quanto para o lambda3. E essa entidade \xe9 a Microsoft. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Alegre" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png"></p> <p>Explicando melhor: Para que nosso admin no cliente possa adicionar usu\xe1rios que existem no dom\xednio da Lambda3, \xe9 preciso:</p> <ol> <li>Adicionar uma Conta Microsoft como Administrador de Usu\xe1rios em clientedemol3; <li>Adicionar a mesma conta como Usu\xe1rio em lambda3; <li>Adicionar os usu\xe1rios de lambda3 no AAD de clientedemol3.</li></ol> <p>Veja o passo-a-passo ilustrado abaixo:</p> <p><figure><img title="Comece adicionando a conta MSA ao dom&iacute;nio do cliente" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Comece adicionando a conta MSA ao dom&iacute;nio do cliente" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-17.png" width="484" height="240"><figcaption>Comece adicionando a conta MSA ao dom\xednio do cliente</figcaption></figure></p> <p><figure><img title="N&atilde;o se esque&ccedil;a de configurar a conta como User Admin" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="N&atilde;o se esque&ccedil;a de configurar a conta como User Admin" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-16.png" width="484" height="312"><figcaption>N\xe3o se esque\xe7a de configurar a conta como User Admin</figcaption></figure></p> <p><figure><img title="Agora fa&ccedil;a o mesmo no dom&iacute;nio lambda3. Desta vez, por&eacute;m adicione o usu&aacute;rio no papel de User" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Agora fa&ccedil;a o mesmo no dom&iacute;nio lambda3. Desta vez, por&eacute;m adicione o usu&aacute;rio no papel de User" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-18.png" width="484" height="303"><figcaption>Agora fa\xe7a o mesmo no dom\xednio lambda3. Desta vez, por\xe9m, adicione o usu\xe1rio no papel de User</figcaption></figure></p> <p><figure><img title="Pronto! Agora volte ao dom&iacute;nio clientedemol3 (logado como adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com) e cadastre os usu&aacute;rios do dom&iacute;nio lambda3 (1), informando simplesmente os seus e-mails (2)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Pronto! Agora volte ao dom&iacute;nio clientedemol3 (logado como adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com) e cadastre os usu&aacute;rios do dom&iacute;nio lambda3 (1), informando simplesmente os seus e-mails (2)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-19.png" width="484" height="286"><figcaption>Pronto! Agora volte ao dom\xednio clientedemol3 (conectado como <a href="mailto:adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com">adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com</a>) e cadastre os usu\xe1rios do dom\xednio lambda3 (1), informando simplesmente os seus e-mails (2)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>E s\xf3 para n\xe3o perdermos o h\xe1bito: Uma vez adicionado o usu\xe1rio ao AAD, agora \xe9 s\xf3 ir na tela de usu\xe1rios do VSTS e adicionar o usu\xe1rio normalmente. </p> <h3>Convites Azure Active Directory B2B</h3> <p>Se voc\xea conseguiu chegar at\xe9 aqui, percebeu que permitir o acesso de usu\xe1rios externos a uma conta do VSTS est\xe1 longe de ser algo simples e consistente, ainda que seja algo relativamente comum e que tende a ser visto mais e mais por a\xed, \xe0 medida que as empresas come\xe7am a perder o medo da nuvem e levam seus <em>workloads</em> para l\xe1. Ciente da import\xe2ncia da federa\xe7\xe3o entre dom\xednios (por todos os motivos que j\xe1 vimos ao longo deste post), a Microsoft come\xe7ou a investir na solu\xe7\xe3o definitiva para tratar de maneira consistente essa rela\xe7\xe3o de confian\xe7a entre <em>tenants</em> Azure AD: o <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-b2b-collaboration-overview/" target="_blank">Azure Active Directory B2B Collaboration</a>.</p> <p>Em poucas palavras, o Azure AD B2B \xe9 a ferramenta da Microsoft para integrar identidades entre empresas parceiras atrav\xe9s de mecanismos simplificados de configura\xe7\xe3o e gest\xe3o. No futuro eu provavelmente farei um post a respeito. No momento, se voc\xea quiser saber mais a respeito de como o Azure AD B2B funciona, assista a <a href="https://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Azure-Active-Directory-Videos-Demos/Azure-Active-Directory-B2B-collaboration-demo" target="_blank">este v\xeddeo</a>. </p> <p>Nas palavras da Microsoft:</p> <blockquote> <p>[O Azure AD B2B collaboration] simplifies management and improves security of partner access to corporate resources including SaaS apps such as Office 365, Salesforce and more, Azure Services and every mobile, cloud and on-premises claims-aware application.B2B collaboration improves security, as partners manage their own accounts and enterprises can apply security policies to partner identities access.</p> <p>Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration is easy to configure with simplified signup for partners of all sizes even if they don\'t have their own Azure AD via an email-verified process. It is also easy to maintain with no external directories or per partner federation configurations.</p></blockquote> <p>Para usar o Azure AD B2B com o VSTS, vamos usar o modelo de convites por email. A vantagem dessa abordagem, quando comparada com a anterior, \xe9 que n\xe3o precisamos adicionar a Conta Microsoft do administrador do nosso cliente em nosso dom\xednio para que ele possa convidar nossos desenvolvedores. Muito melhor, n\xe3o?</p> <p>Vamos come\xe7ar criando os convites. Na vers\xe3o de <em>preview</em> (atualmente o Azure AD B2B est\xe1 em <em>public preview</em>) \xe9 preciso criar um <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-b2b-references-csv-file-format/" target="_blank">arquivo CSV</a> com a lista de usu\xe1rios que ser\xe3o convidados. O admin do cliente, partindo de um <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-b2b-references-csv-file-format/#sample-csv-file" target="_blank">arquivo de exemplo</a>, construiria um CSV como o abaixo para convidar os desenvolvedores da Lambda3. Ou seja, ainda que no exemplo abaixo ele esteja convidando apenas a mim, poderia ter convidado v\xe1rios desenvolvedores/consultores de um vez. Mais uma vantagem do Azure AD B2B sobre o modelo de usu\xe1rio comum nos dois dom\xednios.</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-20.png"><img title="Arquivo CSV de convite para o Azure AD B2B, aberto no Excel (clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Arquivo CSV de convite para o Azure AD B2B, aberto no Excel" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-7.png" width="644" height="44"></a><figcaption>Arquivo CSV de convite para o Azure AD B2B, aberto no Excel (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Com o CSV preparado, entre na op\xe7\xe3o de adicionar usu\xe1rios do Portal do Azure para fazermos upload do CSV:</p> <p><figure><img title="No di&aacute;logo de Adicionar Usu&aacute;rio, selecione a op&ccedil;&atilde;o de empresas parceiras (1) e carregue o arquivo CSV que criamos (2) (clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="No di&aacute;logo de Adicionar Usu&aacute;rio, selecione a op&ccedil;&atilde;o de empresas parceiras (1) e carregue o arquivo CSV que criamos (2)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-21.png" width="1075" height="531"><figcaption>No di\xe1logo de Adicionar Usu\xe1rio, selecione a op\xe7\xe3o de empresas parceiras (1) e carregue o arquivo CSV que criamos (2) (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Depois do upload do CSV, voc\xea tem acesso a um relat\xf3rio onde \xe9 poss\xedvel acompanhar o processo do envio e aceite dos convites:</p> <p><figure><img title="Relat&oacute;rio de acompanhamento de convites do Azure AD B2B" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Relat&oacute;rio de acompanhamento de convites do Azure AD B2B" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-22.png" width="1714" height="760"><figcaption>Relat\xf3rio de acompanhamento de convites do Azure AD B2B</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Cada um dos desenvolvedores recebe um e-mail com o convite. Ao aceitar, \xe9 redirecionado automaticamente para o VSTS do cliente!</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-23.png"><img title="E-mail com convite enviado pelo Azure AD B2B (clique para ampliar)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="E-mail com convite enviado pelo Azure AD B2B" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-8.png" width="644" height="336"></a><figcaption>E-mail com convite enviado pelo Azure AD B2B (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Para concluir o processo: Uma vez que o convite tenha sido aceito (e, por conseguinte, o usu\xe1rio tenha sido adicionado ao AAD), agora \xe9 s\xf3 ir na tela de usu\xe1rios do VSTS e adicionar o usu\xe1rio normalmente.</p> <h2>Concluindo\u2026</h2> <p>Este post acabou muito mais longo do que eu esperava quando comecei a escrev\xea-lo, mas achei que devia registrar aqui esse conhecimento que \u2013 francamente \u2013 n\xe3o achei consolidado em lugar nenhum.</p> <p>E voc\xea, caro leitor? Tem uma situa\xe7\xe3o parecida em sua empresa? O que achou dessas dicas? Deixe seu coment\xe1rio!</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Um abra\xe7o,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Igor</p>', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-6.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-17.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-16.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-18.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-19.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-7.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-21.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-22.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-8.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/04/19/autenticando-usuarios-externos-no-vsts/', 'date': u'2016-04-19 20:21:59', 'slug': u'autenticando-usuarios-externos-no-vsts', 'title': u'Autenticando usu\xe1rios externos no VSTS', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM'], u'post_translations': [u'c76088b8-6b06-4e42-ad84-1f3c7db01778'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'ADFS', u'Azure', u'Azure AD', u'VSTS']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'12381', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-8.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'<p>A typical scenario for users of VSTS <a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/visual-studio-team-services-vs.aspx" target="_blank">(Visual Studio Team Servi</a>ces, formerly Visual Studio Online) need free access to external users. For example, a company that hires vendors for outsourced software development needs to grant access to teams in the supplier who will act in the projects stored in your VSTS.</p> <p>VSTS allows this problem to be solved from different ways, which vary according to the ease of implementation and convenience in use. Come take a look in this post how to enable this scenario in his account of VSTS.</p><!--more--><p>As mentioned above, the VSTS is extremely flexible in terms of authentication model. This means that there are several ways of solving the access of external users (people outside your company) to its corporate account of VSTS. In this post I will discuss some of the possible approaches:</p> <ol> <li><a href="#cen1">Basic scenario: MSA Users</a> <li><a href="#cen2">Intermediate scenario: Azure simple SSO AD without</a> <li><a href="#cen3" target="_blank">Advanced scenario: Azure Federated SSO with AD</a></li></ol> <p>For each of these scenarios, we assume the existence of two entities:</p> <ul> <li><strong>The clien</strong>t: Our client is the fictitious company &quot;customer Demo L3&quot;. The VSTS account i<strong>s clientedemol3.visualstudio.co</strong>m and your domain AD is clien<strong>tedemol3.onmicrosoft.com Azur</strong>e. Our client has a user &quot;admin&quot; <em>respo</em>nsible for the administration of the ADF and VSTS account domain. His email is <strong><a href="mailto:admin@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com">admin@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com</a></strong>. This same user has a Microsoft Account associated with the email adm<a href="mailto:adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com">-clientedemol3@outlook.com</a>. <li><strong>Supplier: th</strong>e supplier will be the Lambda3, of cours<img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Alegre" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png">e. The domain AD Lambda3 Azure, in our example, is the <strong>lambda3.com.br</strong>. Already the Lambda3 user I will (Igor Abbot), with the email i<a href="mailto:igor.abade[arroba]lambda3.com.br" target="_blank">gor.abade[arroba]lambda3.com.br</a>.</li></ul> <p>But what do we see? I want to show you how the cust<strong>omer Demo L3 </strong>could give access to an external user-in our example, I \u2013 so he could perform in a project in your VSTS cli<strong>entedemol3.visualstudio.com</strong>. As you can imagine, this is a fairly common scenario for us, since our developers and/or ALM consultants require access to the accounts of VSTS our customers whenever we participate in any project.</p> <h2><a name="cen1"></a>Basic scenario: MSA Users</h2> <p>The first scenario considers a client who, for some reason, choose not to use a field Azure AD integrated into VSTS to manage the identities of its developers. This is the simplest scenario of all, since it depends only on the account of VSTS. Actually, when VSTS was released (when it was still called VSO), this was the only possible scenario. The ADF support came only after.</p> <p>When there is no ADF directory associated with an account, VSTS identities<strong> need to</strong> be Microsoft Accounts (<em><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/account" target="_blank">&quot;Microsoft Accoun</a></em>t&quot; or MSA). It means that anyone who wants to access our fictional account clientedemol3.visualstudio.com needs, first, create a Microsoft Account in ac<a href="https://account.microsoft.com" target="_blank">count.microsoft.com</a>. In the early da<strike>ys </strike>of VSO VSTS was how we did here in Lambda3:</p> <ul> <li>Created an account with Microsoft e-mail from Lambda3 (in this case, igor.abad[arroba]elambda3.com.br); <li>Added (&quot;invited&quot;) the user/email on VSTS client account (clientedemol3.visualstudio.com); <li>When I wanted to access the customer&#39;s account, do the login with my MSA.</li></ul> <p align="center"><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-10.png"><img title="Adding a Microsoft VSTS client Demo at L3 (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Adding a Microsoft VSTS client Demo at L3" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-2.png" width="644" height="298"></a><figcaption>Adding a Microsoft VSTS client Demo at L3 (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Although quite simple, this model has a few problems:</p> <ol> <li><strong>Two different identities</strong>. Although I have a Microsoft Account with a user name identical to the one I use in the internal domain Lambda3, they are actually two different things. So I had to keep two sets of credentials, managing two passwords in two completely different systems. This brings us to the second problem, which is ... <li><strong>Lack of &quot;<em>single sign-on</em>&quot;</strong>. How are two different accounts, be authenticated in the domain of Lambda3 wasn&#39;t enough. I need to authenticate again when I wanted to access the VSTS client account. In addition, the MSA account belongs to me, not to the company. With this, it is not possible to make any kind of corporate management for that user. Obvious things, how to block a user when he shut down the company, are impossible when using MSA accounts. Finally ... <li><strong>Personal identity (non-corporate)</strong>. As we said, the MSA belong to the individuals who created them and not to the companies. In this way, there is absolutely no corporate control (such as password policy or account lockout) that can be done for you.</li></ol> <p>Obviously this model is not ideal for a company and, therefore, Microsoft extended the service to offer an enterprise-level solution to access VSTS \u2013 integration with the ADF.</p> <h2><a name="cen2"></a>Intermediate scenario: Azure simple SSO AD without</h2> <p>Customers using the Azure VSTS integrated AD (see how to integrate the two here) d<font style="background-color: #ffff00"></font><a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/get-started/setup/manage-organization-access-for-your-account-vs" target="_blank">o no</a><font style="background-color: #ffff00"></font>t depend on more Microsoft accounts to give access to your account from the VS Team Services. Instead, they use your domain account in the cloud. The most important benefit of this is that identity management is no longer distributed (as with the MSA Accounts, where each user creates and cares for their own account) and happens to be centered (the user creation and management is done by the domain administrator AAD). In fact, many companies began to consider using the VSTS after ADF support because of their need to manage identities and access in a more &quot;corporate&quot;.</p> <p>When the Azure AD enters the equation, everything changes. The identity control is no longer done in VSTS and passes it to the directory in Azure. The first consequence of this is that you no longer have the option to continue simply adding Microsoft VSTS Accounts. All accounts need not necessarily come from the directory.</p> <p>This premise-&quot;all<em> the accounts must come from the direct</em>ory&quot;-leaves us with two options:</p> <ol> <li>To continue using Microsoft Accounts (MSA); <li>Create local users in the domain.</li></ol> <h3>To continue using Microsoft Accounts (MSA)</h3> <p>&quot;Huh?&quot;, you might be wondering. &quot;But he did not just say that you can&#39;t use MSA accounts?&quot;</p> <p>Well, what I said is that you can&#39;t just add MSA accounts. But with a bit of complication, everything works. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Alegre" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png"></p> <p>What changes is <strong>that</strong>, before you add an account MSA to VSTS we first need to add it to the ADF. That is, only one more step and the process continues as we saw above.</p> <p>Visit th<a href="https://manage.windowsazure.com/" target="_blank">e classic Azure Portal </a>and go to the Administration page of your directory. On the <strong>Users</strong> we will include access to an MSA account to the domain:</p> <p align="center"><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-11.png"><img title="To add a user to the ADF access the MSA classic Azure Portal and indicate the type of user (1) and the MSA account email (2) (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="To add a user to the ADF access the MSA classic Azure Portal and indicate the type of user (1) and the MSA account email (2)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-3.png" width="484" height="407"></a><figcaption>To add a user to the ADF access the MSA classic Azure Portal and indicate the type of user (1) and the MSA account email (2) (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p><a name="cen3"></a></p> <p>Once added the user to the ADF, now you just go on the screen of the VSTS user and add the user normally. He will be listed as part of the domain of the ADA.</p> <h3>Create local users in the field</h3> <p>A better option, so that you don&#39;t have to depend on MSA Accounts, is to create local accounts on the Azure AD. Thus, the responsibility of creating access ceases to be the supplier and developer becomes the client \u2014 that retains control over this identity.</p> <p>Returning to our example: instead of creating an account with my email from MSA Lambda3, my client would create a user for me <strong><a href="mailto:igor.abade_lambda3@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.com">(igor.abade_lambda3@clientedemol3.onmicrosoft.c</a></strong>om) in his domain:</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-13.png"><img title="Create a new user in the ADF. A common pattern is to put the user name and the company name (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Create a new user in the ADF. A common pattern is to put the user name and company name" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-5.png" width="484" height="417"></a><figcaption>Create a new user in the ADF. A common pattern is to put the user name and the company name (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>To create a user in the Azure is also your AD must be informed friendly name and its role:</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-14.png"><img title="Details of the new user. Tip: be sure to identify the company (1), paper-which should be User (2) and optionally authentication support multi-factor algorithm (3) (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Details of the new user. Tip: be sure to identify the company (1), paper-which should be User (2) and optionally authentication support multi-factor algorithm (3)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-6.png" width="484" height="390"></a><figcaption>Details of the new user. Tip: be sure to identify the company (1), paper-which should be User (2) and optionally authentication support multi-factor algorithm (3) (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Again (we&#39;re already getting stars!): Once added the user to the ADF, now you just go on the screen of the VSTS user and add the user normally. </p> <h2>Advanced scenario: Azure Federated SSO with AD</h2> <p>This is, by far, the coolest setting. In fact, this is exactly the scenario that we have with some of our most important customers. Not only the client is integrated into VSTS Azure AD, but he is also integrated t<strong>o our</strong> Azure AD. With that in addition to all the benefits of security and managing the Azure Active Directory offers, we have access to something pretty cool<a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn441213.aspx" target="_blank"><em>: single sign-o</em>n via ADF</a>S.</p> <p>When using federated access in Azure AD, can I connect to all ADF-backed s<em>ervices (</em>such as VSTS, Office 365, Dynamics CRM, Yammer and others) using my internal AD domain credentials (o<em>n-premises)</em> of Lambda3. With the correct configuration in your browser, no need to enter username and password to access any of these services. <em>Integrated Windows authentication #ftw, baby</em>!</p> <p>The basic principle is: establishes a trust relationship between the domains customer and supplier ADF, so that the users in the domain of the client can add users who belong to the domain of the supplier.</p> <p>That trust, however, is different from that network administrators are accustomed to do when it comes to AD domains. In the AD, we treat that Azure in two different ways:</p> <ol> <li>Common user in two domains <li>Invitations Azure Active Directory B2B</li></ol> <h3>Common user in two domains</h3> <p>Until quite recently this was the only way to establish a trust relationship between two domains ADF in order to add users from one domain to another domain B: both would need to have a common user X to be administrator of users in domain B.</p> <p>In other words: to add the directory &#39; clientedemol3 &#39; a user coming from the domain &#39; lambda3 &#39;, the clientedemol3 directory administrator is a member of lambda3 directory. Is the Act of adding the admin of clientedemol3 in the directory lambda3 establishing the trust \u2013 just that, nothing more is necessary. You can infer, however, that with this we end up in a dilemma of &quot;chicken or egg&quot; as a directory depends on the other. Therefore, in principle depend on a third party that can be trusted for both the clientedemol3 and the directory lambda3. And it is Microsoft. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Alegre" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png"></p> <p>Explaining better: so that our client can add admin users that exist in the field of Lambda3, proceed as follows:</p> <ol> <li>Add a Microsoft Account as administrator of users on clientedemol3; <li>Add the same account as a user in lambda3; <li>Add lambda3 users in the ADF to clientedemol3.</li></ol> <p>See the step-by-step illustrated below:</p> <p><figure><img title="Start by adding the MSA account to the domain of the client" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Start by adding the MSA account to the domain of the client" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-17.png" width="484" height="240"><figcaption>Start by adding the MSA account to the domain of the client</figcaption></figure></p> <p><figure><img title="Don&#39;t forget to configure the account as User Admin" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Don&#39;t forget to configure the account as User Admin" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-16.png" width="484" height="312"><figcaption>Don&#39;t forget to configure the account as User Admin</figcaption></figure></p> <p><figure><img title="Now do the same on lambda3 domain. This time, however add the user in the role of User" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Now do the same on lambda3 domain. This time, however add the user in the role of User" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-18.png" width="484" height="303"><figcaption>Now do the same on lambda3 domain. This time, however, add the user to the role of User</figcaption></figure></p> <p><figure><img title="Ready! Now go back to the domain clientedemol3 (logged in as adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com) and register the domain users lambda3 (1), stating simply your email (2)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Ready! Now go back to the domain clientedemol3 (logged in as adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com) and register the domain users lambda3 (1), stating simply your email (2)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-19.png" width="484" height="286"><figcaption>Ready! Now go back to the domain clientedemol3 (logged<a href="mailto:adm-clientedemol3@outlook.com"> in as adm-clientedemol3@ou</a>tlook.com) and register the domain users lambda3 (1), stating simply your email (2)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>And just to not lose the habit: Once added the user to the ADF, now you just go on the screen of the VSTS user and add the user normally. </p> <h3>Invitations Azure Active Directory B2B</h3> <p>If you managed to get here, realized that allow external users access to an account of VSTS is far from something simple and consistent, even if it&#39;s something relatively common and that tends to be seen more and more around, as companies begin to lose the fear of cloud and take their<em> workloa</em>ds there. Aware of the importance of cross-domain Federation (for all the reasons that we&#39;ve seen throughout this post), Microsoft began to invest in the ultimate solution to treat consistently this trust relationship between ten<em>ants Az</em>ure AD: the A<a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-b2b-collaboration-overview/" target="_blank">zure Active Directory B2B Collaboration</a>.</p> <p>In a nutshell, the Azure is the B2B AD Microsoft tool to integrate identities between companies through simplified configuration and management mechanisms. In the future I&#39;ll probably do a post about it. At the moment, if you want to know more about how the Azure B2B AD works, watch t<a href="https://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Azure-Active-Directory-Videos-Demos/Azure-Active-Directory-B2B-collaboration-demo" target="_blank">his video</a>. </p> <p>In the words of Microsoft:</p> <blockquote> <p>[O Azure AD B2B collaboration] simplifies management and improves security of partner access to corporate resources including SaaS apps such as Office 365, Salesforce and more, Azure Services and every mobile, cloud and on-premises claims-aware application. B2B collaboration improves security, the partners manage their own accounts and enterprises can apply security policies to partner identities access.</p> <p>Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration is easy to configure with simplified signup for partners of all sizes even if they don&#39;t have their own Azure AD via an email-verified process. It is also easy to maintain with no external directories or per partner federation configurations.</p></blockquote> <p>To use the Azure B2B AD with VSTS, we will use the model of invitations by email. The advantage of this approach, when compared with the previous one, is that we don&#39;t need to add the Microsoft Administrator Account of our customer in our area so it can invite our developers. Much better, no?</p> <p>Let&#39;s start by creating the invitations. In the previ<em>ew vers</em>ion (currently the Azure are in pub<em>lic preview B2</em>B AD) you must creat<a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-b2b-references-csv-file-format/" target="_blank">e a CSV fil</a>e with the list of users who will be invited. The admin client, starting<a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-b2b-references-csv-file-format/#sample-csv-file" target="_blank"> from a sample</a> file, build a CSV as the below to invite Lambda3 developers. That is, although in the example below it is inviting only me, could have invited several developers/consultants for a time. Another advantage of the Azure model B2B AD user in two areas.</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-20.png"><img title="CSV file for invitation to the Azure B2B AD, open in Excel (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="CSV file for invitation to the Azure B2B AD, open in Excel" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-7.png" width="644" height="44"></a><figcaption>CSV file for invitation to the Azure B2B AD, open in Excel (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>With the CSV prepared, between the option of adding the Azure Portal users to do upload the CSV:</p> <p><figure><img title="In the add user dialog, select the option to partner companies (1) and load the CSV file you created (2) (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="In the add user dialog, select the option to partner companies (1) and load the CSV file that we create (2)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-21.png" width="1075" height="531"><figcaption>In the add user dialog, select the option to partner companies (1) and load the CSV file you created (2) (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>After the CSV upload, you have access to a report where you can track the shipping process and accept the invitations:</p> <p><figure><img title="Monitoring report of Azure AD B2B invitations" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Monitoring report of Azure AD B2B invitations" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-22.png" width="1714" height="760"><figcaption>Monitoring report of Azure AD B2B invitations</figcaption></figure></p> <p>Each of the developers get an email with the invitation. By accepting, is automatically redirected to the VSTS client.</p> <p><figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-23.png"><img title="E-mail invitation sent by Azure B2B AD (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="E-mail invitation sent by Azure B2B AD" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-8.png" width="644" height="336"></a><figcaption>E-mail invitation sent by Azure B2B AD (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure></p> <p>To complete the process: once the invitation has been accepted (and, therefore, the user has been added to the ADF), now you just go on the screen of the VSTS user and add the user normally.</p> <h2>In conclusion ...</h2> <p>This post turned out much longer than I expected when I started writing it, but I thought I should register here that knowledge that \u2013 frankly \u2013 I didn&#39;t think consolidated anywhere.</p> <p>And you, dear reader? There&#39;s a similar situation in your company? What do you think of these tips? Leave your comment!</p> <p> </p> <p>A hug,<br> Igor</p>', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-6.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-17.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-16.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-18.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-19.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-7.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-21.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image-22.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/image_thumb-8.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/04/19/authenticating-users-foreign-in-vsts/', 'date': u'2016-04-19 20:21:59', 'slug': u'authenticating-users-foreign-in-vsts', 'title': u'Authenticating external users in VSTS', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM'], u'post_translations': [u'c76088b8-6b06-4e42-ad84-1f3c7db01778'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'12981', 'type': u'post'}

Nesta palestra vamos mostrar como devs e IT Pros podem trabalhar juntos para montar um pipeline automatizado de deployment, com foco no processo de smoke tests e de promo\xe7\xe3o/rollback autom\xe1ticos.</blockquote> <!--more--> Ah, quer o PPT da palestra?
