.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'<em><strong>(UPDATE: 7/9/201</strong>6 Slides of the lectures of .NET and available tests on the body of the post)</em> Guys, this week starts the 2016 Edition of The Developers Conference (TDC) in S\xe3o Paulo. Once again I will have the privilege of being able to speak in that which is already one of the largest (if not the largest) for developers of Brazil. Will we meet there? <!--more--> <h2>My lectures</h2> This year I will give lectures in four different tracks. These are the issues that I will present throughout the week: <h3>.NET trail (Wednesday, 06/07)</h3> <strong>Support macros in your application with PowerShe</strong>ll (15:10-16:00) <blockquote>Have you ever thought about support macros in your application, as do Microsoft Office applications? Or allow your user to customize your ERP using ... PowerShell? Come and learn in this talk as he boarded the PowerShell within your application to use it as a macro language.</blockquote> <iframe style="border: 1px solid #CCC; border-width: 1px; margin-bottom: 5px; max-width: 100%;" src="//www.slideshare.net/slideshow/embed_code/key/wUoRzKFfEndcG5" width="595" height="485" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"> </iframe> <div style="margin-bottom: 5px;"> <strong><a title="Support macros in your application with PowerShell" href="//www.slideshare.net/igoravl/suporte-a-macros-na-sua-aplicao-com-powershell" target="_blank">Support macros in your application with PowerShe</a>l</strong>l from<strong><a href="//www.slideshare.net/igoravl" target="_blank"> Igor Abbot</a></strong></div> <h3>DevOps .NET track (Thursday, 07/07)</h3> <strong>Nightly build + automated Pipeline: your new best friends </strong>(12:10-13:00) <blockquote>Continuous integration is an excellent tool for improving the quality of a development team, but it doesn&#39;t solve all problems-among other things because I don&#39;t have time to run all the tests for CI. Come see this lecture how to set up a nightly build that takes advantage of automation tools release pipeline to do automatic provisioning environments and execution of automated tests with VSTS, Release Management and Azure (IaaS and PaaS)</blockquote> <h3>Track tests (Friday, 08/07)</h3> <strong>Exploratory tests are not synonymous with mes</strong>s! (11:30-11:45) <blockquote>Exploratory test for many people is synonymous with something without proceedings or organization-just an excuse to get out sailing for the application and try to find any errors. Nothing further from the truth! Come see this speech as a simple plugin in Chrome can help organize your exploratory testing process, helping in the collection and recording of evidence.</blockquote> <iframe style="border: 1px solid #CCC; border-width: 1px; margin-bottom: 5px; max-width: 100%;" src="//www.slideshare.net/slideshow/embed_code/key/4clgGEK9XXC2kq" width="595" height="485" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"> </iframe> <div style="margin-bottom: 5px;"> <strong><a title="Exploratory tests are not synonymous with mess!" href="//www.slideshare.net/igoravl/testes-exploratrios-no-so-sinnimo-de-baguna" target="_blank">Exploratory tests are not synonymous with mess!</a> </strong> from <strong><a href="//www.slideshare.net/igoravl" target="_blank">Igor Abbot</a></strong></div> <h3>Track II Tests (Saturday, 09/07)</h3> <strong>Accelerate and improve! -feedback with automated tests</strong> (11:25-12:00) <blockquote>Many people believe that test automation is a Holy Grail and that Selenium is the answer to all the problems of quality in Web applications. But if your tests are slow and fragile, that they serve? Come see how to use tools such as PhantomJS and Web Performance Tests to speed up and simplify the implementation of automated testing of Web apps.</blockquote> <iframe style="border: 1px solid #CCC; border-width: 1px; margin-bottom: 5px; max-width: 100%;" src="//www.slideshare.net/slideshow/embed_code/key/3uOgJqfg68jeJN" width="595" height="485" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"> </iframe> <div style="margin-bottom: 5px;"> <strong><a title="Accelerate and improve! -automated testing with fast feedback" href="//www.slideshare.net/igoravl/acelere-e-melhore-o-feedback-com-testes-automatizados-rpidos" target="_blank">Accelerate and improve! -automated testing with fast feedback</a> </strong>from <strong><a href="//www.slideshare.net/igoravl" target="_blank">Igor Abbot</a></strong></div> <h2>#Partiu TDC?</h2> Go to the event? Want to exchange ideas about these and other subject related to the topic of development of applications? So look for us in the space of the event there Lambda3. I and other Lambdas will be there \u2013 will be glad to visit with them! A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': [], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/07/04/my-lectures-on-tdc-2016-de-sao-paulo/', 'date': u'2016-07-04 20:52:58', 'slug': u'my-lectures-on-tdc-2016-de-sao-paulo', 'title': u'My lectures on TDC 2016 de S\xe3o Paulo', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM', u'Development', u'Events'], u'post_translations': [u'1a7e39cd-c551-471a-93b0-96ee0d089cf4'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'14891', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-07/my-lectures-on-tdc-2016-de-sao-paulo/2016-07-04-Post.md
.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Recentemente <a href="http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/05/02/faca-backup-automatico-de-documentos-com-onedrive/#comments" target="_blank">recebi a seguinte pergunta</a> no meu post sobre <a href="http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/05/02/faca-backup-automatico-de-documentos-com-onedrive/" target="_blank">backup usando OneDrive</a>: <blockquote>Igor muito bom sua explica\xe7\xe3o.. mas me tira uma d\xfavida. Se caso minha m\xe1quina pegar um Ransonware, n\xe3o sei se voc\xea sabe j\xe1 o que ele faz, mas caso n\xe3o saiba, ele criptografa e bloqueia todos os arquivos do meu pc, todos eles mesmo. Ser\xe1 que uma vez em nuvem e deixar de forma autom\xe1tica, ele far\xe1 isso com os arquivos nas nuvens tamb\xe9m?</blockquote> \xd3tima pergunta! Vamos falar sobre <em>ransomware</em> e suas implica\xe7\xf5es sobre o OneDrive. <!--more--> Primeiramente\u2026 Sabe o que \xe9 <em>ransomware</em>? <blockquote>Ransomware is a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptovirology">Cryptovirology</a> attack carried out using covertly installed malware that <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption">encrypts</a> the victim\'s files and then requests a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransom">ransom</a> payment in return for the decryption key that is needed to recover the encrypted files. -- <a title="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware</a></blockquote> Em outras palavras, <em>ransomware</em> \xe9 um tipo de <em>malware</em> (como um v\xedrus de computador) que criptografa os arquivos pessoais de um usu\xe1rio de computador, tornando-os inacess\xedveis. O prop\xf3sito dos malfeitores \xe9 cobrar um resgate (\u201c<em>ransom</em>\u201d) em troca da senha que descriptografa os arquivos. \xc9 como se, de repente, todos os seus arquivos pessoais tivessem sido sequestrados! Tenebroso, n\xe3o? Voltemos \xe0 pergunta que deu origem a este post. O Matheus quer saber se um <em>ransomware</em> afetaria os arquivos sincronizados pelo OneDrive. Em outras palavras, \u201ca c\xf3pia na nuvem tamb\xe9m seria criptografada?\u201d A resposta \xe9 <strong>sim</strong>. A c\xf3pia dos arquivos no OneDrive tamb\xe9m seria afetada. Mas isso n\xe3o significa que os bandidos venceram. N\xe3o mesmo! Uma funcionalidade pouco conhecida do OneDrive \xe9 o Hist\xf3rico de Arquivos: Ele mant\xe9m automaticamente as \xfaltimas vers\xf5es de seus arquivos, cada vez que voc\xea os salva. <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-5.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="image" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png" alt="image" width="484" height="333" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Acessando o Hist\xf3rico de Vers\xf5es do OneDrive (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure><strong>IMPORTANTE</strong>: O Hist\xf3rico de Arquivos funciona apenas para arquivos do Office. Pelo menos at\xe9 onde pude testar, outros arquivos como imagens n\xe3o s\xe3o versionados. <h2>Recuperando um arquivo criptografado por ransomware</h2> Se voc\xea foi atacado por um ransomware e teve seus documentos criptografados, ver\xe1 algo assim ao tentar acessar a \xfaltima vers\xe3o de seu documento na web: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-2.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Vers\xe3o mais recente de um documento ap\xf3s ser corrompida por um ransomware (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png" alt="Vers\xe3o mais recente de um documento ap\xf3s ser corrompida por um ransomware" width="484" height="298" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Vers\xe3o mais recente de um documento ap\xf3s ser corrompida por um ransomware (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure>Neste caso, voc\xea pode usar o OneDrive para recuperar ao menos os documentos do Office. A partir de um outro computador (ou ap\xf3s reformatar o computador contaminado), clique numa vers\xe3o anterior \xe0 corrompida (a pen\xfaltima vers\xe3o \xe9 provavelmente a escolha \xf3bvia; se estiver tamb\xe9m corrompida, tente uma anterior) e use o comando <strong>Restore</strong>: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-3.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Restaurando uma vers\xe3o anterior de um documento (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png" alt="Restaurando uma vers\xe3o anterior de um documento" width="484" height="298" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Restaurando uma vers\xe3o anterior de um documento (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure>Isso vai restaurar o documento para uma vers\xe3o anterior ao ataque do ransomware. Agora \xe9 poss\xedvel acessar novamente seu documento, tanto a partir da web quanto diretamente num computador onde a sincroniza\xe7\xe3o esteja ligada: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-4.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Arquivo recuperado ap\xf3s restaurar vers\xe3o anterior (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png" alt="Arquivo recuperado ap\xf3s restaurar vers\xe3o anterior" width="484" height="298" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Arquivo recuperado ap\xf3s restaurar vers\xe3o anterior (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure> <h2>Conclus\xe3o</h2> Viu como o OneDrive pode ajudar com o versionamento de arquivos do Office? Ele n\xe3o oferece uma prote\xe7\xe3o completa a todos os seus arquivos, afinal o Hist\xf3rico de Vers\xf5es funciona apenas para documentos do Office. Entretanto, ele serve pelo menos como esperan\xe7a para algu\xe9m que venha a ser v\xedtima de <em>ransomware</em> \u2013 s\xe3o grandes as chances de que uma parte de seus arquivos poderia ser recuperada. Nada disso diminui, contudo, a import\xe2ncia de um processo abrangente de backup! Por falar em backup, voc\xea conhece a <a href="http://www.hanselman.com/blog/TheComputerBackupRuleOfThree.aspx" target="_blank">Regra de Tr\xeas dos Backups</a>? <ol> <ul> <li><strong>3 c\xf3pias de qualquer coisa que seja importante para voc\xea.</strong> Duas c\xf3pias n\xe3o s\xe3o suficientes se for um arquivo importante;</li> <li><strong>2 formatos diferentes</strong>. Por exemplo, Dropbox+DVDs ou HD externo+Memory Stick ou Pen-drive+OneDrive\u2026</li> <li><strong>1 backup <em>off-site.</em></strong> E se a casa pegar fogo?!</li> </ul> </ol> E voc\xea, como faz backup dos seus dados? Compartilhe nos coment\xe1rios! &nbsp; Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/07/18/ransomware-e-onedrive/', 'date': u'2016-07-18 12:00:00', 'slug': u'ransomware-e-onedrive', 'title': u'Ransomware e OneDrive', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Dicas'], u'post_translations': [u'49dfaaa4-2941-46e5-a780-ba4f5051b9e2'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'Backup', u'Malware', u'OneDrive', u'Ransomware']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'14951', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Recently I re<a href="http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/05/02/faca-backup-automatico-de-documentos-com-onedrive/#comments" target="_blank">ceived the following quest</a>ion in my post abou<a href="http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/05/02/faca-backup-automatico-de-documentos-com-onedrive/" target="_blank">t backup using OneDriv</a>e: <blockquote>Igor very good your explanation but get me out a doubt. If my machine get a Ransonware, don&#39;t know if you know what it does, but in case you didn&#39;t know, it encrypts and locks all files from my pc, all of them even. Will a time in cloud and stop automatically, he will do it with the files in the clouds, too?</blockquote> Great question! Let&#39;s talk about r<em>ansomware </em>and its implications on the OneDrive. <!--more--> First ... You know what it&#39;s like <em>to ransomwar</em>e? <blockquote>Ransomware is th<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptovirology">e attack carri</a>ed out using Cryptovirology covertly installed malware that<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption"> encrypt</a>s the victim&#39;s files and then requests th<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransom">e rans</a>om payment in return for the decryption key that is needed to recover the encrypted files. --<a title="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware</a></blockquote> In other words, r<em>ansomware</em> is a type o<em>f malw</em>are (such as a computer virus) which encrypts personal files of a computer user, making them inaccessible. The purpose of evildoers is to levy a ransom (ran<em>som) i</em>n Exchange for the password that decrypts the files. It&#39;s as if, suddenly, all your personal files had been kidnapped. Scary, isn&#39;t it? Back to the question that gave rise to this post. Matheus wants to know if a<em> ransomwar</em>e would affect the files synchronized by OneDrive. In other words, &quot;the copy in the cloud would also be encrypted?&quot; The answer is<strong> Ye</strong>s. The copy of the files in OneDrive would also be affected. But that doesn&#39;t mean the bad guys won. Not even! A little known feature of OneDrive is the file history: it automatically maintains the latest versions of your files, every time you save. <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-5.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="image" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png" alt="image" width="484" height="333" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Accessing the OneDrive version history (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure><strong>IMPORTA</strong>NT: the file history works only for Office files. At least as far as I could test, other files such as images are not versioned. <h2>Retrieving a file encrypted by ransomware</h2> If you were attacked by a ransomware and had its encrypted documents, you will see something like this when trying to access the latest version of your document on the web: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-2.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Latest version of a document after being corrupted by a ransomware (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png" alt="Latest version of a document after being corrupted by a ransomware" width="484" height="298" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Latest version of a document after being corrupted by a ransomware (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure>In this case, you can use the OneDrive to retrieve at least the Office documents. From another computer (or after reformat the infected computer), click a previous version to the corrupted (the penultimate version is probably the obvious choice; if it is too corrupted, try an earlier) and use the Restore <strong>command</strong>: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-3.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Restoring a previous version of a document (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png" alt="Restoring a previous version of a document" width="484" height="298" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Restoring a previous version of a document (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure>This will restore the document to an earlier version to ransomware attack. Now you can access your document again, both from the web as directly on a computer where the syncing is turned on: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-4.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Recovered file after restoring previous version (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png" alt="Recovered file after restoring previous version" width="484" height="298" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Recovered file after restoring previous version (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure> <h2>Conclusion</h2> See how the OneDrive can help with Office file versioning? He does not offer a complete protection to all your files, after all the history of Versions works only for Office documents. However, it serves at least as hope for someone who will fall victim to<em> ransomw</em>are-are great chances that some part of your files could be retrieved. None of this diminishes, however, the importance of a comprehensive backup process. Speaking of backup, you know the ru<a href="http://www.hanselman.com/blog/TheComputerBackupRuleOfThree.aspx" target="_blank">le of three of the Backup</a>s? <ol> <ul> <li><strong>3 copies of anything that is important to you.</strong> Two copies are not sufficient if an important file;</li> <li><strong>2 different formats</strong>. For example, Dropbox + DVDs or external HD + Memory Stick or Flash drive + OneDrive ...</li> <li><strong>1 off-sit<em>e backup.</em></strong> And if the House burns down?</li> </ul> </ol> And you, as does backup of your data? Share in the comments! A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/07/18/ransomware-and-onedrive/', 'date': u'2016-07-18 12:00:00', 'slug': u'ransomware-and-onedrive', 'title': u'Ransomware and OneDrive', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Tips'], u'post_translations': [u'49dfaaa4-2941-46e5-a780-ba4f5051b9e2'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'15261', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-07/ransomware-and-onedrive/2016-07-18-Post.md
URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-5.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-2.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-3.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-4.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'A little while ago arose within the time of ALM Lambda3 a rich discussion about the licensing model of the Visual Studio Build Service Team Services (VSTS). What? You didn&#39;t know that builds in VSTS are charged? Then you better read this post. <!--more--> T<a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/visual-studio-team-services-vs.aspx" target="_blank">he Visual Studio Team Se</a>rvices offe<a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/features/continuous-integration-vs.aspx" target="_blank">rs a build and deployment automation s</a>erving not only to accounts held in the VSTS itself, but also the external repositories like GitHub. The same agents who offer the services build automation are also used for the automation of releases. In other words, the discussion in this post covers not only Build but also Release Management. There are various levels of service and billing models to Build of VSTS. So, let me first reassure you all: despite being licensed, the build service provides a basic level (and free) service. Phew! <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Smile" /> Let&#39;s meet so the free build. <h2>Free Service</h2> The free service offers 240<strong> minutes per month </strong>of time to build and/or release. In other words, if your team has a CI build lasting an average of five minutes, you will be able to run some 50 builds a month. It&#39;s not little, but certainly not enough for most teams. In addition to the limited amount of minutes per month, the free service is restricted to either: <ul> <li><strong>Maximum duration of 30 minutes for a single build and/or releas</strong>e. That way, if any of your builds (or releases) take more than half an hour, it will be aborted;</li> <li><strong>Only one jo<em>b s</em>imultaneousl</strong>y. You can run only one thing (either build or release) at a time. If other builds are scheduled, they will stay in the queue (FIFO) until the build in progress finish.</li> </ul> <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-9.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Build service in free mode in classic Azure Portal (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-9.png" alt="Build service in free mode in classic Azure Portal" width="1452" height="513" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Build service in free mode in classic Azure Portal (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure>Needs more build than the free service is able to offer? So let&#39;s talk more parrudas options. <h2>Paid service</h2> To have access to paid services, the first course of action is to <a href="https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/setup-admin/team-services/set-up-billing-for-your-account-vs">configure the collectio</a>n (<em>&quot;billin</em>g&quot;) in his account of VSTS. After this step, you can hire the services of additional build. <h3>Hosted Agents</h3> Your first option to be able to run more builds is to hire a hosted Build Agent (&quot;H<em>osted Build Agent</em>&quot;). With him, you have a machine administered and maintained by Microsoft \u2013 you only pay for the use. When you choose a hosted agent you don&#39;t pay extra for minutes, but a fixed value o<strong>f $ 40 per month</strong>. This means that, regardless of the number of builds that you run, you pay only a fixed amount. There are, however, some limitations: <ul> <li><strong>Up to 360 minutes for a single build and/or release</strong>. Because, come and let&#39;s face it: If your build takes more than 6 hours to finish, he deserves to be aborted. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-openmouthedsmile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/wlEmoticon-openmouthedsmile.png" alt="Open-mouthed smile" /></li> <li><strong>Only one jo<em>b s</em>imultaneousl</strong>y. As in the free service, you can&#39;t run more than one build agent at a time. However, you can hire an a<strong>gent and, in th</strong>is case, could have more concurrent jobs (a j<em>ob </em>for agent).</li> </ul> <h3>Private agents</h3> Hosted agents discussed above are quite convenient-after all, you don&#39;t need to worry about servicing them \u2013 but they have a big &quot;but&quot;: you can&#39;t install anything on them! If you want to have control over what&#39;s installed on your build agent-for example, your system has dependencies that must be previously installed on the build machine-then hosted agents are not an option. In this case, the solution is to<strong> use private agent</strong>s. Private agents build machines are created and maintained by you. Because they are yours, may be<em> on-premises</em> or in a virtual machine in the cloud. Can be Windows, Linux or Mac. And can run any software you want and/or need. And, most of all, you don&#39;t pay by use and can run jobs, in the quantity you want. Your cost is only th<strong>e agent lic</strong>ensing: the<strong> first agent is free, bu</strong>t from the second private agent must be paid 15 b<strong>ucks a month fo</strong>r the right to use that agent. <h3>Activating the paid service</h3> The Azure Portal, you can access your account options of VSTS and add hosted and/or private agents in the section B<em>uild and Deployment service</em>: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-11.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="The build service configuration: hosted (1) Agents and private agents (2) (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-11.png" alt="The build service configuration: hosted (1) Agents and private agents (2)" width="1028" height="514" border="0" /></a><figcaption>The build service configuration: hosted (1) Agents and private agents (2) (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure> <h3>XAML Builds</h3> If you are still using XAML, Builds the options above do not apply to you. You can&#39;t hire agents and private agents or hosted. In this case, your alternative is to buy additional minutes. With more minutes, you can run more builds a month. To buy more minutes you can access the con<a href="https://manage.windowsazure.com/#Workspaces/VisualStudioExtension">figuration section of the Visual Studio Team Ser</a>vic<a href="https://manage.windowsazure.com/">es classic Azure Portal</a>. On the configuration page of your VSTS, click the scale tab (&quot;Scale&quot;) to access the payment plans of various services of VSTS. Once there, change the Build to Pay (&quot;Paid&quot;) and set the maximum consumption (to avoid &quot;surprises&quot; at the end of the month!). If the ceiling of minutes is reached, the build service is switched off until the following month to not generate additional charges. <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image-10.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Enabling the service paid to build hosted (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-10.png" alt="Enabling the service paid to build hosted" width="1028" height="634" border="0" /></a><figcaption>Enabling the service paid to build hosted (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure> <h3>Conclusion</h3> The build service of VSTS is quite flexible and powerful \u2013 not only technically but also in their billing models. You can find a model that fits best in your team&#39;s profile and offering the best cost-benefit ratio. And you, uses the services of build of VSTS? Share your experience with us in the comments! A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/wlEmoticon-smile.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-9.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/wlEmoticon-openmouthedsmile.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-11.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-10.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/07/26/how-and-licensed-the-service-to-build-of-visual-studio-team-services/', 'date': u'2016-07-26 12:30:00', 'slug': u'how-and-licensed-the-service-to-build-of-visual-studio-team-services', 'title': u'How is licensed Visual Studio build service Team Services?', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM'], u'post_translations': [u'622f2ad9-32f4-4932-a910-47c79d181f55'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'15551', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/wlEmoticon-smile.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-9.png|||

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-11.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-10.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/image_thumb-10.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'<em>O mundo era um lugar muito mais simples de se viver. Designers e desenvolvedores podiam integrar conte\xfados de diferentes sites sempre que quisessem. Bastava um IFRAME e pronto. A imagina\xe7\xe3o era o limite.</em> <em>Eram bons tempos. Todos viviam felizes e em paz, numa grande aldeia global onde todos eram irm\xe3os e compartilhavam livremente seus sites.</em> <em>Foi quando surgiu o clickjacking. O mundo como conhec\xedamos deixou de existir e a livre coexist\xeancia passou a ser uma lembran\xe7a distante...</em> <p style="font-size: small; text-align: right;">ABADE, Igor. "Lendas Antigas da Teia Mundial"</p> <!--more-->Brincadeiras \xe0 parte, uma coisa \xe9 fato: <em>Clickjacking</em> mudou para sempre o comportamento da tag IFRAME nas p\xe1ginas HTML. Explicando: A motiva\xe7\xe3o deste post veio de uma <em>thread</em> de emails na lista do time de produto do VSTS. L\xe1, algu\xe9m perguntou o seguinte: <blockquote>We make use of Jenkins to schedule various test executions. Today, I was thinking I could simply create a custom hub that would host the Jenkins site within an IFRAME within the Test hub in our VSTS account. However, quickly testing this idea out seems to show that I can\u2019t do that. Possibly due to some CORS limitations? Is it possible to host an IFRAME in a custom hub in VSTS showing content from outside the VSTS account? If so, does someone have an example?</blockquote> Em outras palavras: Teria algum jeito de hospedar uma p\xe1gina externa (neste caso, uma p\xe1gina do Jenkins) dentro do VSTS? D\xe1 para imaginar um monte de cen\xe1rios onde isso seria \xfatil: Mostrar builds do Jenkins, an\xe1lises de c\xf3digo do Sonar, documenta\xe7\xe3o do SharePoint\u2026 Tudo direto na interface Web do VSTS. Legal, n\xe9? S\xf3 tem um probleminha: <blockquote>Current versions of Jenkins have the X-Frame-Options headers set to disallow IFraming the Jenkins site for security reasons (...) Sites don\u2019t allow iframing because you can use that for clickjacking.</blockquote> Hein? Quer dizer que sites n\xe3o permitem mais que se fa\xe7a uso de IFRAME? Tudo por causa do tal do <strong><em>clickjacking</em></strong>? <h2>Clickjacking</h2> <a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Clickjacking" target="_blank">Clickjacking</a> \xe9 uma t\xe9cnica usada por sites maliciosos para enganar usu\xe1rios e for\xe7a-los a clicar em p\xe1ginas que eles n\xe3o queriam. \xc9 como se o malfeitor estivesse \u201csequestrando\u201d os cliques do usu\xe1rios, redirecionando-os de um site leg\xedtimo para outro malicioso. Da\xed o nome (\u201c<em><strong>click</strong> hi<strong>jacking</strong></em>\u201d). <img style="float: none; margin-left: auto; display: block; margin-right: auto;" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg" width="480" height="265" /> V\xe1rios sites foram v\xedtimas de clickjacking no passado, como Twitter e Facebook. At\xe9 mesmo o Flash Player passou por maus bocados por uso de t\xe9cnicas de clickjacking. Como o ataque se baseia no uso de um IFRAME transparente contendo uma p\xe1gina de um site leg\xedtimo, era preciso que esses mesmos sites pudessem pedir aos browsers para que n\xe3o fossem abertos dentro de um IFRAME. Dessa maneira \u2013 impedindo a abertura da p\xe1gina num IFRAME \u2013 estariam protegidos contra esse tipo de ataque. Surgiu ent\xe3o o <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options" target="_blank">cabe\xe7alho HTTP X-Frame-Options</a>. Se voc\xea quiser <strong>impedir</strong> que seu site seja aberto em um IFRAME por um outro site qualquer (inclusive sites seus, que estejam no mesmo dom\xednio), deve adicionar o seguinte cabe\xe7alho <pre>X-Frame-Options: DENY</pre> Um meio-termo - liberar o uso de IFRAME entre p\xe1ginas do seu site, mas sem permitir o uso externo - pode ser obtido assim: <pre>X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN</pre> Por fim, voc\xea pode liberar o uso de IFRAME para um site espec\xedfico. Ou seja, se voc\xea quiser que um site externo fict\xedcio <strong>www.abc.com</strong> possa usar um IFRAME para exibir uma p\xe1gina vinda do seu site, voc\xea colocaria <strong>em seu site</strong> o cabe\xe7alho: <pre>X-Frame-Options: ALLOW-FROM: http://www.abc.com</pre> Quer ver como funciona? Ent\xe3o crie uma p\xe1gina HTML com o c\xf3digo abaixo. <pre class="brush: html">&lt;html&gt; &lt;body&gt; &lt;iframe src="https://www.google.com" width="800" height="800"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt; &lt;/body&gt; &lt;/html&gt; </pre> Agora abra-a e veja o que acontece: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="IFRAME bloqueado pelo uso do cabe\xe7alho X-Frame-Options (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png" alt="IFRAME bloqueado pelo uso do cabe\xe7alho X-Frame-Options" width="644" height="390" border="0" /></a> <figcaption>IFRAME bloqueado pelo uso do cabe\xe7alho X-Frame-Options (clique para ampliar)</figcaption></figure>Ou seja: Se voc\xea quer embutir uma p\xe1gina vinda de algum site ou servi\xe7o que limita o <em>iframing</em> atrav\xe9s da tag X-Frame-Options, ent\xe3o \xe9 <em>no dice</em>. N\xe3o vai funcionar. <h2>Op\xe7\xf5es?</h2> Se ainda assim voc\xea quiser, como no nosso exemplo, usar IFRAME para criar um <em>widget</em> para o TFS que exiba uma p\xe1gina do Jenkins, tem duas op\xe7\xf5es: <h3>Remover cabe\xe7alho X-Frame-Options</h3> Esta \xe9 a solu\xe7\xe3o mais \xf3bvia, mas tamb\xe9m a mais complicada. Isso porque ela, tipicamente, envolve a altera\xe7\xe3o do c\xf3digo-fonte da aplica\xe7\xe3o original ou, ao menos, algum ajuste no servidor Web (Apache ou IIS) que est\xe1 servindo a aplica\xe7\xe3o. <h3>CORS e jQuery</h3> Uma outra alternativa \xe9: ao inv\xe9s de um IFRAME puro e simples, \xe9 usar o <a href="http://api.jquery.com/load/" target="_blank">m\xe9todo Load() do jQuery</a>. Entretanto, para carregar uma p\xe1gina hospedada em outro site, \xe9 preciso primeiramente configurar as permiss\xf5es de CORS \u2013 que v\xeam com sua pr\xf3pria cota de complica\xe7\xe3o. <h2>Conclus\xe3o</h2> A verdade \xe9 que n\xe3o tem solu\xe7\xe3o f\xe1cil. O risco de clickjacking tornou o uso de IFRAME algo excessivamente complicado e que tende a cair cada vez mais em desuso. E voc\xea, caro leitor? J\xe1 se deparou com esse tipo de situa\xe7\xe3o? Tem alguma ideia/sugest\xe3o de como lidar com isso? Deixe seu coment\xe1rio! &nbsp; Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/08/18/sobre-iframe-e-clickjacking/', 'date': u'2016-08-18 17:05:01', 'slug': u'sobre-iframe-e-clickjacking', 'title': u'Sobre IFRAME e clickjacking', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Desenvolvimento'], u'post_translations': [u'83b7c776-007c-4ae1-8382-af7f1b4f3ab3'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'15652', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-08/sobre-iframe-e-clickjacking/2016-08-18-Post.md
URL Parse: http|4.bp.blogspot.com|/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg|||
Downloading http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'<em>The world was a much simpler place to live. Designers and developers could integrate content from different sites whenever they wanted to. One IFRAME and ready. The imagination was the limit.</em> <em>They were good times. They all lived happy and at peace, in a great global village where all were brothers and shared freely their sites.</em> <em>That&#39;s when the clickjacking. The world as we knew it no longer exists and the free coexistence has become a distant memory.</em> <p style="font-size: small; text-align: right;">ABBOT, Igor. &quot;Ancient legends of the Web world&quot;</p> <!--more-->All kidding aside, one thing is indeed<em>: Clickjacki</em>ng forever changed the behavior of the IFRAME tag in HTML pages. Explaining: the motivation for this post came from<em> a thr</em>ead of emails on the list of the VSTS product team. There, someone asked the following: <blockquote>We make use of Jenkins to schedule various test executions. Today, I was thinking I could simply create a custom hub that would host the Jenkins site within an IFRAME within the hub in our VSTS Test account. However, quickly testing this idea out seems to show that I can&#39;t do that. Possibly due to some CORS limitations? Is it possible to host an IFRAME in a custom hub in VSTS showing content from outside the VSTS account? If so, does someone have an example?</blockquote> In other words: would there be any way to host an external page (in this case, a page of Jenkins) within the VSTS? You can imagine a lot of scenarios where this would be useful: Show builds of Jenkins, Sonar code analysis, SharePoint documentation. All straight into the VSTS Web interface. Cool, huh? There&#39;s just one small problem: <blockquote>Current versions of Jenkins have the X-Frame-Options headers set to disallow IFraming the Jenkins site for security reasons (. ..) Don &#39; t allow iframing sites because you can use that for clickjacking.</blockquote> Huh? I mean that sites do not allow more that make use of IFRAME? Everything to do with that of <strong><em>clickjacking</em></strong>? <h2>Clickjacking</h2> <a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Clickjacking" target="_blank">Clickjackin</a>g is a technique used by malicious websites to trick users and force them to click on pages that they didn&#39;t want to. It&#39;s as if the malefactor was &quot;hijacking&quot; users clicks, redirecting them to a legitimate site to another malicious. Hence the name<em><strong> (&quot;cli</strong>ck <strong>hijackin</strong></em>g&quot;). <img style="float: none; margin-left: auto; display: block; margin-right: auto;" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg" width="480" height="265" /> Several sites have been victims of clickjacking in the past, such as Twitter and Facebook. Even the Flash Player had a hard time by using clickjacking techniques. As the attack is based on the use of a transparent IFRAME containing a page of a legitimate site, those same sites could ask for browsers that were not open in an IFRAME. This way \u2013 preventing the opening of the page in an IFRAME-would be protected against this type of attack. Then came the<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options" target="_blank"> HTTP header X-Frame-Options</a>. If you want to<strong> preven</strong>t your site from being open in an IFRAME on another website (including its Web sites, which are in the same domain), you must add the following header <pre>X-Frame-Options: DENY</pre> A compromise-free the use of IFRAME between pages on your site, but without allowing external use-can be obtained as follows: <pre>X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN</pre> Finally, you can release the use of IFRAME to a specific site. That is, if you want an external site could use <strong>an IFRAME w</strong>ww.abc.com fictional to display a page from your site, you would place o<strong>n your site</strong> the header: <pre>X-Frame-Options: ALLOW-FROM: http://www.abc.com</pre> You want to see how it works? Then create an HTML page with the code below. <pre class="brush: html">&lt;html>&lt;/html> &lt;body>&lt;/body> &lt;iframe src=&quot;https://www.google.com&quot; width=&quot;800&quot; height=&quot;800&quot;>&lt;/iframe> </pre> Now open it and see what happens: <figure><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="IFRAME blocked by use of the X-Frame-Options header (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png" alt="IFRAME blocked by use of the X-Frame-Options header" width="644" height="390" border="0" /></a> <figcaption>IFRAME blocked by use of the X-Frame-Options header (click to enlarge)</figcaption></figure>IE: If you want to embed a page from any Web site or service that limits the ifr<em>aming th</em>rough tag X-Frame-Options, so it&#39;s in t<em>he dice</em>. It&#39;s not going to work. <h2>Options?</h2> If you still want to, as in our example, using IFRAME to create a wid<em>get t</em>o TFS that displays a page of Jenkins, have two options: <h3>Remove X-Frame-Options header</h3> This is the most obvious solution, but also the most complicated. That&#39;s because she typically involves changing the source code of the original application or, at least, some setting on the Web server (Apache or IIS) that is serving the application. <h3>CORS and jQuery</h3> Another alternative is: instead of an IFRAME, pure and simple, is to use th<a href="http://api.jquery.com/load/" target="_blank">e load() method of jQuer</a>y. However, to load a page hosted on another site, you must first configure the permissions of CORS \u2013 that come with their own share of complication. <h2>Conclusion</h2> The truth is that there&#39;s no easy solution. The risk of clickjacking has made the use of IFRAME something overly complicated and that tends to fall more and more in disuse. And you, dear reader? Have you come across this kind of situation? Do you have any idea/suggestion on how to deal with this? Leave your comment! A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/08/18/about-iframe-and-clickjacking/', 'date': u'2016-08-18 17:05:01', 'slug': u'about-iframe-and-clickjacking', 'title': u'About IFRAME and clickjacking', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Development'], u'post_translations': [u'83b7c776-007c-4ae1-8382-af7f1b4f3ab3'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'15851', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-08/about-iframe-and-clickjacking/2016-08-18-Post.md
URL Parse: http|4.bp.blogspot.com|/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg|||
Downloading http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_yNUEUpiUj0A/S-tzfELyenI/AAAAAAAAHP0/FWCRi9frdgM/s1600/Clickjacking_diagram-724769.jpg... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Sabe quando uma coisa n\xe3o funciona e assim que voc\xea come\xe7a a fu\xe7ar, come\xe7a a puxar outra, e outra, e outra\u2026? Pois \xe9. Tudo come\xe7ou com um VHD maior do que devia. E chegou no servi\xe7o do Log de Eventos do Windows que n\xe3o funcionava. Mas pelo menos agora tudo est\xe1 funcionando normalmente. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Smile" /> <!--more--> &nbsp; Por conta da nova s\xe9rie de posts sobre controle de legados no TFS, precisei subir uma m\xe1quina virtual com Windows 7 x86. Depois de instalar o que precisava e de rodar o Windows Update (quase trezentas atualiza\xe7\xf5es!), me deparei com um problema: Apesar de o <em>guest</em> estar usando apenas 18 GB de espa\xe7o em disco, o VHD tinha sido totalmente expandido (consumindo seu m\xe1ximo de 127 GB). <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-1.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="image" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb-1.png" alt="image" width="644" height="383" border="0" /></a> <figure><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="&quot;Guest&quot; gastando apenas 18 GB do VHD" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-2.png" alt="&quot;Guest&quot; gastando apenas 18 GB do VHD" width="644" height="391" border="0" /><figcaption><em>Guest</em> gastando apenas 18 GB do VHD mas 127 GB no <em>host</em></figcaption></figure>Tentei usar a fun\xe7\xe3o de <em>Compact</em> do Hyper-V (que remove o espa\xe7o livre do disco para reduzir seu consumo no <em>host</em>) mas ele n\xe3o conseguiu reduzir nada, o que tipicamente indica um disco virtual fragmentado. Para conseguir compact\xe1-lo precisaria, primeiramente, desfragmentar o <em>guest</em>. E \xe9 a\xed que a est\xf3ria come\xe7a a ficar divertida. <h2>O problema</h2> Quando tentei rodar o Desfragmentador de Discos no Windows 7 da VM, obtive o seguinte erro: <pre>Disk Defragmenter cannot start because the task scheduler service is not running. Start the task scheduler service and try again.</pre> Esquisito, n\xe9? Bom, fui conferir e o servi\xe7o do Task Scheduler realmente estava parado. Quando eu tento inici\xe1-lo manualmente, outro erro: <pre>Windows could not start the Task Scheduler service on Local Computer. Error 1068: The dependency service or group failed to start.</pre> Hum, ent\xe3o tem algum servi\xe7o de que o Task Scheduler depende e que n\xe3o est\xe1 funcionando. Quais s\xe3o os servi\xe7os de que ele depende? <figure><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="Lista de servi\xe7os de que o Task Scheduler depende" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-3.png" alt="Lista de servi\xe7os de que o Task Scheduler depende" width="571" height="644" border="0" /><figcaption>Lista de servi\xe7os de que o Task Scheduler depende</figcaption></figure>Agora que sei que o Task Scheduler depende de dois servi\xe7os (Remote Procedure Call, Windows Event Log), preciso ver se algum deles est\xe1 parado e n\xe3o est\xe1 conseguindo subir. O servi\xe7o de RPC estava normal; j\xe1 o servi\xe7o de Log de Eventos do Windows estava com problemas: <pre>Windows could not start the Windows Event Log service on Local Computer. Error 1079: The account specified for this service is different from the account specified for other services running in the same process. </pre> Eita! O Log de Eventos n\xe3o est\xe1 funcionando! A mensagem de erros, por incr\xedvel que pare\xe7a, \xe9 bem clara: o Log de Eventos est\xe1 configurado para usar uma conta diferente de outros servi\xe7os que est\xe3o rodando dentro do mesmo Host de Servi\xe7os. Sabe aquele processo svchost.exe que voc\xea v\xea no Task Manager e n\xe3o faz ideia de para qu\xea serve? Ent\xe3o, ele \xe9 um Host de Servi\xe7os, \u201chospedando\u201d servi\xe7os como o Task Scheduler. Procurando na internet pela mensagem de erro 1079, achei um <a href="https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2478117">artigo</a> da Base de Conhecimentos da Microsoft (\u201cKB article\u201d) falando sobre o problema, indicando que \xe9 um erro conhecido. A solu\xe7\xe3o \xe9 <strong>trocar a conta de logon do servi\xe7o Task Scheduler</strong>, mudando de System para <strong>LocalService</strong>. <h2>A solu\xe7\xe3o</h2> Num prompt elevado, execute a seguinte linha de comando: <pre class="brush:shell">sc.exe config "eventlog" obj= "NT AUTHORITY\\LocalService"</pre> &nbsp; Reinicie o computador e <em>voil\xe0!</em> \u2013 tudo de volta ao lugar <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Smile" /> &nbsp; Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/08/24/resolvido-erro-1079-the-account-specified-for-this-service-is-different/', 'date': u'2016-08-24 18:15:00', 'slug': u'resolvido-erro-1079-the-account-specified-for-this-service-is-different', 'title': u'Resolvido: Erro 1079 (The account specified for this service is different\u2026)', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Dicas'], u'post_translations': [u'7b67aad3-2ed8-44e6-8025-79a0d6a3d815'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'Windows 7']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'16001', 'type': u'post'}

.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Quem disse que \xe9 preciso estar na vers\xe3o mais nova das linguagens de programa\xe7\xe3o da moda para poder adotar pr\xe1ticas de DevOps e usar uma ferramenta de ALM como o TFS ou o VSTS? Nesta s\xe9rie de posts, quero mostrar como a manuten\xe7\xe3o de seus projetos legados pode ser muito mais simples do que voc\xea imagina se voc\xea se permitir experimentar. &nbsp; <!--more--> Uma vez ouvi falar que o significado de \u201csoftware legado\u201d era \u201c<i>software que funciona</i>\u201d. Nada mais verdadeiro! As aplica\xe7\xf5es que comumente chamamos de legado \u2013 aquelas que usam tecnologias antigas, por vezes at\xe9 obsoletas \u2013 s\xf3 est\xe3o a\xed at\xe9 hoje porque ainda funcionam. Ou seja, frequentemente n\xe3o h\xe1 nenhum motivador de neg\xf3cios que justifique reescrever o sistema numa nova tecnologia, plataforma ou linguagem. Modernizar para qu\xea? Afinal, ele funciona! O que os times respons\xe1veis por projetos legados acabam esquecendo \xe9 que manter seu sistema numa linguagem antiga n\xe3o significa, necessariamente, continuar usando pr\xe1ticas de desenvolvimento antigas. Longe disso! Nesta s\xe9rie de posts quero compartilhar algumas dicas de como integrar os projetos legados nas tecnologias que mais temos visto nossos clientes usarem. Na maioria deles, nosso time de Consultores de ALM teve a oportunidade de ajuda-los a adotar as pr\xe1ticas e ferramentas descritas nesta s\xe9rie. .{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Who says you have to be on newer version of fashion programming languages to be able to adopt practices of DevOps and use a tool like ALM TFS or VSTS? In this series of posts, I want to show you how to maintain their legacy projects can be more simple than you think if you allow yourself to experience. <!--more--> Once I heard that the meaning of &quot;legacy software&quot; was &quot;<i>software that works</i>&quot;. Nothing more true. Applications that commonly call legacy \u2013 those using old technologies, sometimes even obsolete-they&#39;re just there to this day because they still work. That is, often there is no business motivator to justify rewriting the system in a new technology, platform or language. Modernize for what? After all, it works! What the teams responsible for legacy projects end up forgetting is to keep your system in an ancient language does not necessarily mean to continue using old development practices. Far from it! In this series of posts I want to share some tips on how to integrate the legacy projects in technologies that have seen our customers use. In most of them, our team of consultants of ALM was given the opportunity to help them to adopt the practices and tools described in this series. In other words, more than theoretical knowledge, is experience. <h2>Part 1-Delphi 7</h2> For posts about Delphi, I&#39;ll use the version 7.0 as it is more commonly found in legacy Delphi projects in our customers. <ul> <li><a href="http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/10/06/controle-de-verso-de-projetos-delphi-7-no-tfs/">Legacy project versioning Delphi 7</a></li> <li>Build automation Legacy Project Delphi 7</li> <li>Test automation Legacy Project Delphi 7</li> <li>Release automation Legacy Project Delphi 7</li> </ul> <h2>Part 2-Visual Basic 6</h2> We couldn&#39;t let the venerable VB6 out, huh? J <ul> <li>Version control of legacy VB 6 projects</li> <li>Build automation of legacy VB 6 projects</li> <li>Test automation of legacy VB 6 projects</li> <li>Automation of release of legacy VB 6 projects</li> </ul> <h2>Part 3-classic ASP</h2> Believe me, it is still full of ASP sites out there. <ul> <li>ASP projects version control</li> <li>Automation of build and release of ASP projects</li> </ul> <h2>Part 4-other tools</h2> <ul> <li>Version control, build and release for PowerBuilder</li> <li>Version control, build and release to Progress projects</li> <li>Version control, build and release for Clipper projects</li> </ul> As the various posts are published, the links will be updated on this page. Do not miss! Oh, there&#39;s another legacy technology that you use in your company and would like to see in this series of posts? Then leave a comment with your suggestion. Maybe extended the series to include your idea? ;-) A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': [], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/08/29/control-your-legacy-projects-in-tfs/', 'date': u'2016-08-29 12:45:00', 'slug': u'control-your-legacy-projects-in-tfs', 'title': u'Control your legacy projects in TFS', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM'], u'post_translations': [u'41225f9b-fd7c-4d20-9688-5baa8e91096c'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'15941', 'type': u'post'}

.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'You know when something doesn&#39;t work and as soon as you start digging, starts pulling another, and another, and another ...? As it is. It all started with a VHD larger than I should. And arrived at the event Log service of Windows that did not work. But at least now everything is working normally. <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Smile" /> <!--more--> On the new series of posts about legacy control in TFS, I needed to go up a virtual machine with Windows 7 x 86. After installing what I needed and run Windows Update (almost 300 updates!), I came across a problem: Although the gu<em>est </em>be using only 18 GB of disk space, the VHD had been fully expanded (consuming their maximum of 127 GB). <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-1.png"><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="image" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb-1.png" alt="image" width="644" height="383" border="0" /></a> <figure><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="&quot;Guest&quot; spending just 18 GB VHD" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-2.png" alt="&quot;Guest&quot; spending just 18 GB VHD" width="644" height="391" border="0" /><figcaption><em>Gues</em>t spending just 18 GB but 127 GB VHD on the <em>host</em></figcaption></figure>I tried to use the Comp<em>act of </em>Hyper-V (which removes the free disk space to reduce their consumption on t<em>he h</em>ost) but he failed to reduce anything, which typically indicates a virtual disk fragmented. To be able to compress it would need, first, defragment the <em>guest</em>. And that&#39;s where the story starts to get fun. <h2>The problem</h2> When I tried to run the Disk Defragmenter in Windows 7 VM&#39;s, I got the following error: <pre>Disk Defragmenter cannot start because the task scheduler service is not running. Start the task scheduler service and try again.</pre> Weird, huh? Well, I was checking out and the Task Scheduler service was stopped. When I try to start it manually, another error: <pre>Windows could not start the Task Scheduler service on Local Computer. Error 1068: The dependency service or group failed to start.</pre> UM, so is there a service that depends on Task Scheduler and it&#39;s not working. What are the services it depends on? <figure><img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border-width: 0px;" title="List of services that the Task Scheduler depends on" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-3.png" alt="List of services that the Task Scheduler depends on" width="571" height="644" border="0" /><figcaption>List of services that the Task Scheduler depends on</figcaption></figure>Now that I know the Task Scheduler relies on two services (Remote Procedure Call, Windows Event Log), I need to see if any of them is stopped and can&#39;t climb. The RPC service was normal; already the service Windows Event Log was in trouble: <pre>Windows could not start the Windows Event Log service on Local Computer. Error 1079: The account specified for this service is different from the account specified for other services running in the same process. </pre> Jeez! The event Log is not working! The error message, oddly enough, is very clear: the event Log is configured to use a different account to other services that are running within the same Host. You know that svchost.exe process that you see in the Task Manager and you have no idea what? So, he is a Host of services, &quot;hosting&quot; services such as the Task Scheduler. Looking on the internet for 1079 error message, I found an <a href="https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2478117">articl</a>e from the Microsoft Knowledge Base (&quot;KB article&quot;) talking about the problem, indicating that it is a known error. The solution<strong> is to change the logon account of the Task Scheduler</strong> service, changing System t<strong>o LocalServic</strong>e. <h2>The solution</h2> In an elevated prompt, run the following command line: <pre class="brush:shell">sc.exe config &quot;eventlog&quot; obj = &quot;NT AUTHORITYLocalService&quot;</pre> Restart the computer<em> and v</em>oila! -everything back <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png" alt="Smile" /> A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image_thumb-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/08/24/solved-error-1079-the-account-specified-for-this-service-is-different/', 'date': u'2016-08-24 18:15:00', 'slug': u'solved-error-1079-the-account-specified-for-this-service-is-different', 'title': u'Solved: error 1079 (The account specified for this service is different ...)', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Tips'], u'post_translations': [u'7b67aad3-2ed8-44e6-8025-79a0d6a3d815'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'16061', 'type': u'post'}

.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Este post \xe9, de certa forma, uma continua\xe7\xe3o do post de ontem. Depois que resolvi o problema do desfragmentador, descobri que ainda assim n\xe3o conseguia diminuir meu VHD. N\xe3o importava o que eu fizesse, o tamanho continua em 127 GB. At\xe9 que eu descobri a solu\xe7\xe3o para o problema. <!--more--> Mesmo desfragmentando o disco (rodando o Defrag dentro da VM), desligando a VM e usando o comando Compact do Hyper-V, n\xe3o adiantava. O tamanho continuava o mesmo. A solu\xe7\xe3o \xe9 esquecer o Hyper-V e ir direto a quem resolve: a linha de comando <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png" alt="Smile" /> <h2>Passo 1: Otimizar o disco virtual</h2> Abra um prompt elevado e digite: <pre class="brush:shell">diskpart select vdisk file="c:\\seu\\arquivo.vhd" attach vdisk list volume </pre> Neste ponto, o DISKPART ir\xe1 listar os volumes montados em seu computador. O VHD que voc\xea acabou de montar deve ser o \xfaltimo volume. Verifique no seu caso qual a letra atribu\xedda ao seu VHD e anote-a. <figure><img style="float: none; margin-left: auto; display: block; margin-right: auto;" title="Disco virtual montado no host. Note que neste exemplo o volume \xe9 o G:" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/SNAGHTML5c66b09.png" alt="Disco virtual montado no host. Note que neste exemplo o volume \xe9 o G:" width="640" height="464" /> <figcaption>Disco virtual montado no host. Note que neste exemplo o volume \xe9 o G:</figcaption></figure>Agora voc\xea precisa desfragmentar o disco. Primeiramente digite <code>exit</code> para sair do DISKPART. A seguir, digite o seguinte comando: <pre class="brush:shell">defrag G: /o /v</pre> Onde <strong>G:</strong> corresponde ao drive que voc\xea anotou na etapa anterior. <h2>Passo 2: Compactar o disco virtual</h2> Agora vamos terminar o processo no DISKPART. Basicamente o que vamos fazer \xe9: <ul> <li>Desmontar o VHD (que est\xe1 em modo <em>read-write</em>);</li> <li>Remontar o VHD em modo <em>read-only</em>;</li> <li>Compactar o VHD;</li> <li>Desmontar o VHD.</li> </ul> De volta ao nosso prompt elevado, digite: <pre class="brush:shell">diskpart detach disk select vdisk file="c:\\seu\\arquivo.vhd" attach vdisk readonly compact vdisk exit </pre> <em>Presto</em>! Agora nosso VHD, que antes se recusava a sair dos 127 GB, chegou no tamanho \u201ccorreto\u201d: <img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border: 0px;" title="image" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-5.png" alt="image" width="644" height="376" border="0" /> &nbsp; Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/SNAGHTML5c66b09.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-5.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/08/25/como-diminuir-o-tamanho-de-um-arquivo-vhd-vhdx/', 'date': u'2016-08-25 12:45:00', 'slug': u'como-diminuir-o-tamanho-de-um-arquivo-vhd-vhdx', 'title': u'Como diminuir o tamanho de um arquivo VHD / VHDX', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Dicas'], u'post_translations': [u'0f0d930e-5f02-4ea0-b49d-2df15052d3cb'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'Hyper-V', u'Windows 10']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'16171', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-08/como-diminuir-o-tamanho-de-um-arquivo-vhd-vhdx/2016-08-25-Post.md
URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/SNAGHTML5c66b09.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/SNAGHTML5c66b09.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-5.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-5.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'This post is, in some ways, a continuation of yesterday&#39;s post. After they solved the problem of the Defragmenter, I discovered that I still couldn&#39;t lower my VHD. No matter what I did, the size remains in 127 GB. Until I discovered the solution to the problem. <!--more--> Even defragmenting the disk (running the Defrag inside the VM), shutting down the VM and using Compact command of Hyper-V, no point. The size remained the same. The solution is to forget the Hyper-V and go straight to whoever solves: the command line <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-style: none;" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png" alt="Smile" /> <h2>Step 1: Optimize the virtual disk</h2> Open a command prompt and type: <pre class="brush:shell">DiskPart Select vdisk file = &quot;c:seuarquivo.vhd&quot; attach vdisk list volume </pre> At this point, DISKPART will list the mounted volumes on your computer. The VHD that you just set up should be the last volume. Check in your case what is the letter assigned to your VHD and write it down. <figure><img style="float: none; margin-left: auto; display: block; margin-right: auto;" title="Virtual disk mounted on the host. Note that in this example the volume is the g:" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/SNAGHTML5c66b09.png" alt="Virtual disk mounted on the host. Note that in this example the volume is the g:" width="640" height="464" /> <figcaption>Virtual disk mounted on the host. Note that in this example the volume is the g:</figcaption></figure>Now you need to defragment the disk. First type exit <code>to </code>leave the DISKPART. Next, type the following command: <pre class="brush:shell">Defrag g:/o/v</pre> Where<strong> g</strong>: corresponds to the drive that you noted in the previous step. <h2>Step 2: Compress the virtual disk</h2> Now let&#39;s finish the process in DISKPART. Basically what we do is: <ul> <li>Unmount the VHD (in read-wr<em>ite mode</em>);</li> <li>Reassemble the VHD in rea<em>d-only mod</em>e;</li> <li>Compact the VHD;</li> <li>Unmount the VHD.</li> </ul> Back to our elevated prompt, type: <pre class="brush:shell">DiskPart Detach disk Select vdisk file = &quot;c:seuarquivo.vhd&quot; attach vdisk readonly Compact vdisk exit </pre> <em>Presto</em>! Now our VHD, which previously refused to get out of 127 GB, arrived at the &quot;correct&quot; size: <img style="background-image: none; float: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; margin-left: auto; display: block; padding-right: 0px; margin-right: auto; border: 0px;" title="image" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-5.png" alt="image" width="644" height="376" border="0" /> A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/wlEmoticon-smile-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/SNAGHTML5c66b09.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/image-5.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/08/25/how-to-decrease-the-size-of-a-vhd-filevhdx/', 'date': u'2016-08-25 12:45:00', 'slug': u'how-to-decrease-the-size-of-a-vhd-filevhdx', 'title': u'How to decrease the size of a VHD file/VHDX', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Tips'], u'post_translations': [u'0f0d930e-5f02-4ea0-b49d-2df15052d3cb'], u'language': [u'English'], u'post_tag': [u'Hyper-V']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'16301', 'type': u'post'}
