Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-13.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-14.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-14.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'<p>See in this post how to put your designs Delphi 7 under version control in TFS and/or VSTS.</p> <p>(Part 1 of 13 in t<a href="http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/08/29/controle-seus-projetos-legados-no-tfs/">he series under control of legacy projects in TF</a>S)</p><!--more--><p>The overview of version control under the TFS has changed a lot since it was introduced support for Git. Have two different models-the TFVC with a classic centralized approach and the Git with the new world of decentralisation \u2013 of course affects our options, especially in time of supporting technologies and IDEs. Delphi, as is to be expected, is no exception.</p> <p>So, this post will cover the two scenarios \u2013 use of TFVC and using Git-Delphi projects. Let&#39;s start with the TFVC.</p> <h2>TFVC and Delphi integration</h2> <p>The Delphi 7 comes from a time when the &quot;King&quot; of version on the Windows platform was \u2013 believe it or not! -Visual SourceSafe.</p> <p>(<em>And it just occurred to me that most of the devs of Lambda3 should never have seen the VSS. I&#39;m definitely getting old</em>)</p> <p>This means that the IDE of Delphi 7 is optimized for the SourceSafe and its centralized model of<em> lock-modify-unlo</em>ck (i.e. the good old &quot;ch<em>eck out &amp; checked in</em>&quot;). In this way, the TFVC fits like a glove in the user experience offered by the Delphi IDE.</p> <h3>Environment and prerequisites</h3> <p>To align the expectations, it is important you know how I set up my environment. After All,<em><strong><a href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/your_mileage_may_vary" target="_blank"> YMMV</a></strong></em> <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Smile" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/wlEmoticon-smile-5.png"></p> <ul> <li>Windows 7 Ultimate, SP1, x 86, 2 GB RAM <li>Delphi 7 Enterprise</li></ul> <p>Now, let&#39;s talk a little bit about prerequisites:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Team Explorer 20</strong>13: Any integration with TFS passes necessarily by Team Explorer. You can download it from the Microsoft Web site (installation free for licensed users of TFS and/or VSTS). If you already have Visual Studio installed 2013 (Professional or higher) then you do not need to install Team Explorer, because it is already included with the VS. <li><strong>Visual Studio Team Foundation Server MSSCCI Provid</strong>er: &quot;MSSCCI Provider&quot; (pronounced &quot;m<em>iss-kee&quot;</em>) provides the integration between TFS and IDEs that use the MSSCCI interface <em>(Microsoft Source Code Control Interfa</em>ce), created for the SourceSafe integration. In other words, the MSSCCI provider emulates the interface created for SourceSafe, &quot;cheating&quot; old IDEs and making them believe that they are talking to the SourceSafe database. <li><strong>EPocalipse SourceConneXion:</strong> plug-in from a third party (i.e., $ $ $<img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Smile" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/wlEmoticon-smile-5.png">) that makes the integration between Delphi and MSSCCI providers.</li></ul> <p>This integration occurs as whole in the diagram below:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image.png"><img title="High-level diagram with components Delphi-TFS integration (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="High-level diagram with components Delphi-TFS integration" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb.png" width="640" height="89"></a></p> <h3>Configuration of the plug-ins</h3> <p>Here&#39;s the installation process of the various components required for habilitarmos integration. Install them in the following order:</p> <h4>Team Explorer</h4> <p>Start the installation by Team Explorer (TE). You can use the 2012 or 2013<strong> but not 2015</strong>. In other words: you can even have YOU (or VS) 2015 installed on your machine, but it won&#39;t be enough. You still need to install (or VS) 2012 or 2013, because TFS MSSCCI Provider does not work with the 2015.</p> <p>Team Explorer can be obtained in three different ways:</p> <ul> <li>Through a direct download from the Microsoft Web site <font style="background-color: #ffffff"><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30656" target="_blank">(201</a></font>2,<font style="background-color: #ffffff"><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40776" target="_blank"> 201</a></font>3); <li>On the Team Foundation Server media of corresponding version (i.e. == 2012 2012 YOU TFS, TFS 2013 == YOU 2013); <li>Or through the installation of Visual Studio (Professional or higher) of corresponding version. In this case just install the VS; The YOU will be included in the installation.</li></ul> <p>There is too much out of it. Choose one of the three ways above and then just<em> next-next-finis</em>h.</p> <dl> <dd><strong>TIP</strong>: after installing Team Explorer, it is always a good idea to install the Visual Studio Update corresponding to YOUR version you installed, as it may contain bug fixes. Inst<br>all the Up<a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-US/download/details.aspx?id=48708" target="_blank">date 5 </a>in 2012 or YOU U<a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-US/download/details.aspx?id=48129" target="_blank">pdate 5</a> in 2013. </dd></dl> <h4>Visual Studio Team Foundation Server MSSCCI Provider</h4> <p>What should be a very simple installation can become a process a bit confusing. That&#39;s because t<strong>here</strong> are two versions of TFS MSSCCI Provider available in Visual Studio Marketplace:</p> <ul> <li><font style="background-color: #ffffff"><a href="https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/bce06506-be38-47a1-9f29-d3937d3d88d6" target="_blank">Visual Studio Team Foundation Server MSSCCI Provider 2010;</a></font> and <li><font style="background-color: #ffffff"><a href="https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/06c8e056-7f77-4a5c-9b8b-49318c143df8" target="_blank">Visual Studio Team Foundation Server MSSCCI Provider 2013 &amp; 2015</a><strong></strong></font> </li></ul> <p>The difference between both is the version of Team Explorer that each depends on. As a rule, use the 2010 version if you need to install in Windows XP. For newer versions of Windows (such as in our case, we&#39;re using Windows 7) use the 2013 version &amp; 2015 (which works both with the 2013 and 2015). Download the correct version and then jus<em>t next-next-finis</em>h.</p> <dl> <dd><strong>TIP:</strong> sometimes it may be necessary to change the default MSSCCI Provider on your computer. This is especially true if you have other MSSCCI provider (like SourceSafe) installed. In order to use TFS, you must set your MSSCCI provider as the default. The only detail is that there is no native way to do this<br>. You can set the default provid<a href="https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/319318" target="_blank">er directly in the R</a>egistry or download one of the various utilities available for it. In the past I&#39;ve used th<a href="http://sharptoolbox.com/tools/sccswitch" target="_blank">e SccSwit</a>ch, but was discontinued. In my research for this post, I found this in <a href="http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/2264/Sourcecode-Control-Switcher" target="_blank">Code</a>Project.Na doubt<br>, prefer to go directly in the Registry and edit in hand.</dd></dl> <h3>EPocalipse SourceConneXion</h3> <p>As mentioned previously, the SourceConneXion \u2013 key for integration with TFS-is paid. The version for Delphi 7 it cost<a href="http://www.epocalipse.com/buy.htm" target="_blank">s 49 euro</a>s. Oh, before someone asks: neither Lambda3 we have no type of commercial link with the company EPocalipse. I&#39;m indicating the plug-in simply because it was the only option I have found to integrate the Delphi with TFS. The good side is that you<a href="http://www.epocalipse.com/downloads.htm" target="_blank"> can download a 3<em>0 day</em></a>s trial version.</p> <p>After a default installation<em> next-next-fin</em>ish, when opening the Delphi for the first time after installing the initial Setup screen SourceConneXion:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-1.png"><img title="SourceConneXion initial Setup screen (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="SourceConneXion initial Setup screen" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-1.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>In the next step the MSSCCI provider SourceConneXion question which you will use. Select the TFS:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-2.png"><img title="Selecting the MSSCCI provider integrated with SourceConneXion (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Selecting the MSSCCI provider integrated with SourceConneXion" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-2.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>Then it&#39;s time to configure MSSCCI provider specific options in use. In the case of TFS, it gives the option to set the default file block model. The default behavior of the TFS is<strong><em> &quot;No</em></strong>ne&quot; <em>(copy-modify-merg</em>e). If you prefer the exclusive checkout model SourceSafe, select the &quot;Chec<strong><em>k Out&quot; (</em></strong>lo<em>ck-modify-unlock</em>).</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-3.png"><img title="Configuring the default template of TFS file locking (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Setting the default file block model of the TFS" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-3.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>Remember that the SourceConneXion allows you to integrate the Delphi any versioning that supports the MSSCCI API, right? Therefore, a user can connect the Delphi to different version controls which, in turn, can use distinct names for the same operation. Imagine, for example, &quot;Check In&quot; on and &quot;Commit&quot; TFVC in Subversion.</p> <p>To deal with these differences, the SourceConneXion allows you to customize the terms that will be used in its interface. So, you can use the classification corresponding to your version control system. By a happy coincidence, he uses by default TFS the same terms; Therefore, you can accept the suggestions offered.</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-4.png"><img title="Customizing the terminology of the version control system in SourceConneXion (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Customizing the terminology of the version control system in SourceConneXion" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-4.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>With that completed the initial configuration. Note that now there is a menu called Source Control in Delphi, which offers access to the capabilities of TFS. It is through him that we will be adding our project the TFVC repository:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-5.png"><img title="Adding a Delphi project for the first time to a repository TFVC (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Adding a Delphi project for the first time to a repository TFVC" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-5.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>Now, enter the server (actually the Tea<em>m Project Collection) </em>and then select the Team Project where the project will be added:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-6.png"><img title="Selecting the Team Project to add the Project Delphi (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Selecting the Team Project to add the Project Delphi" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-6.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>Then it&#39;s time to indicate which files of your project will be added to version control. Typically you&#39;ll want to add:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-7.png"><img title="Indicating which project files must be added to version control (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Indicating which project files must be added to version control" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-7.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>And finally a screenshot familiar to those accustomed to the TFS. Look at the default screen TFVC check-in there! <img class="wlEmoticon wlEmoticon-smile" style="border-top-style: none; border-left-style: none; border-bottom-style: none; border-right-style: none" alt="Smile" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/wlEmoticon-smile-5.png"></p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-8.png"><img title="Standard dialog box TFS check-in (click to enlarge)" style="border-left-width: 0px; border-right-width: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom-width: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-top-width: 0px" border="0" alt="Standard dialog box TFS check-in" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-8.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>In it we have all the resources that the TFVC offers for our projects: Association with work items, check-in policy, check-in notes. Complete integration.</p> <p>Confirm check-in and ready. Our Delphi project is under version control in TFS.</p> <p><img title="" style="float: none; margin-left: auto; display: block; margin-right: auto" alt="Cool, huh? :-)" src="http://i.giphy.com/oWA8lD03GUew8.gif"></p> <p> </p> <p>From now on, use the Sourc<strong>e Control me</strong>nu to interact with TFS from the Delphi IDE:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-9.png"><img title="Source Control menu with commands to integrate with TFS (click to enlarge)" style="border-top: 0px; border-right: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px" border="0" alt="Source Control menu with commands to integrate with TFS" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-9.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>One of the cool things to have a native integration with version control directly in the IDE is able to have easy access to change history. Source Control menu, select the Show <strong>Difference c</strong>ommand to open the history dialog box. Here, you can select two different changesets to compare the changes between the two versions:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-10.png"><img title="History dialog box, showing two selected changesets (click to enlarge)" style="border-top: 0px; border-right: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px" border="0" alt="History dialog box, showing two selected changesets" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-10.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>Right-click on one of the selected changesets, and then click the Compare c<strong>ommand</strong>. Opens a window of Visual Studio with the diff<em> be</em>tween the two versions of the selected file:</p> <p><a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image-11.png"><img title="Viewing the difference between two versions of a file Delphi (click to enlarge)" style="border-top: 0px; border-right: 0px; background-image: none; border-bottom: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; border-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px" border="0" alt="Viewing the difference between two versions of a file Delphi" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-11.png" width="640" height="480"></a></p> <p>Cool, huh? Now, it may be that your team prefer to use Git. In this case, let&#39;s see how to connect the Delphi to a Git repository of TFS.</p> <h2>Git integration and Delphi</h2>', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/wlEmoticon-smile-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/wlEmoticon-smile-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-4.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-6.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-7.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/wlEmoticon-smile-5.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-8.png', 'http://i.giphy.com/oWA8lD03GUew8.gif', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-9.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-10.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-11.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/10/06/version-control-of-delphi-7-projects-in-tfs/', 'date': u'2016-10-06 14:00:00', 'slug': u'version-control-of-delphi-7-projects-in-tfs', 'title': u'Version control of Delphi 7 projects in TFS', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM'], u'post_translations': [u'5eaabc9c-7add-4f3f-a991-4d0e5ced54fd'], u'language': [u'English'], u'post_tag': [u'Git', u'TFVC']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'17571', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/image_thumb-11.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Voc\xea j\xe1 precisou fazer uma apresenta\xe7\xe3o do PowerPoint pelo Skype, Hangout ou afins? Ainda que ambos tornem bem f\xe1cil compartilhar a tela e mostrar a janela do PowerPoint, a experi\xeancia fica aqu\xe9m do ideal. Mas tem um truque que torna isso bem melhor! <!--more--> Se voc\xea usa o PowerPoint com frequ\xeancia para fazer apresenta\xe7\xf5es ao vivo, usando um projetor, j\xe1 deve ter percebido que ele \xe9 bem \u201cesperto\u201d e faz uns truques bacanas quando voc\xea aperta o F5. Mas especificamente: <ul> <li>Ele muda automaticamente o modo de duas telas do Windows de duplicado para estendido;</li> <li>Na tela principal (no seu computador/notebook) ele abre a janela do Modo de Exibi\xe7\xe3o do Apresentador (<em>Presenter View</em>);</li> <li>Na tela secund\xe1ria (o projetor) ele coloca a apresenta\xe7\xe3o em tela cheia.</li> </ul> Legal, n\xe9? S\xf3 que quando nossa apresenta\xe7\xe3o vai ser pela internet, via Skype ou Hangout, esse comportamento n\xe3o \xe9 t\xe3o legal. Se voc\xea apertar F5 para exibir um PPT durante seu webcast ou reuni\xe3o, vai se deparar com um destes problemas, dependendo da sua configura\xe7\xe3o: <ol> <li><strong>Se voc\xea tiver apenas um monitor</strong>: O PowerPoint vai exibir a apresenta\xe7\xe3o em tela cheia, o que torna mais dif\xedcil controlar a apresenta\xe7\xe3o, pois voc\xea n\xe3o consegue ver as miniaturas dos slides do PowerPoint;</li> <li><strong>Se voc\xea tiver mais de um monitor</strong>: O PowerPoint vai tentar ser \u201cesperto\u201d e jogar a apresenta\xe7\xe3o no segundo monitor. O problema \xe9 que isso normalmente envolve mudan\xe7as de resolu\xe7\xe3o (\xe0s vezes at\xe9 mesmo de DPI), sem contar o fato de que a apresenta\xe7\xe3o muda de monitor. Skype e Hangout podem ficar bem confusos quando esse tipo de mudan\xe7a acontece durante um compartilhamento de tela!</li> </ol> Por isso, normalmente o que vejo as pessoas fazerem \xe9 simplesmente deixar o PowerPoint aberto em Modo de Edi\xe7\xe3o e compartilhar sua janela: <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image-2.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="PowerPoint em modo edi\xe7\xe3o, com a tela sendo compartilhada no Skype for Business (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-2.png" alt="PowerPoint em modo edi\xe7\xe3o, com a tela sendo compartilhada no Skype for Business" width="1028" height="550" border="0" /></a> <dl> <dd><strong>Sobre o upload de apresenta\xe7\xf5es</strong>: Alguns dos servi\xe7os de reuni\xe3o online, como o Skype for Business, permitem que voc\xea fa\xe7a upload dos seus PPTs antes da reuni\xe3o e use os pr\xf3prios recursos da ferramenta (e n\xe3o o PowerPoint) para controlar a apresenta\xe7\xe3o. Sim, esta seria uma solu\xe7\xe3o para este problema, n\xe3o fosse o fato de que (1) nem todos os servi\xe7os oferecem essa facilidade e (2) nos que a oferecem, nem sempre funciona.</dd> </dl> Isso traz, entretanto, um outro problema: No modo de edi\xe7\xe3o as anima\xe7\xf5es n\xe3o funcionam, portanto a experi\xeancia para a audi\xeancia fica aqu\xe9m do desejado: <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image-3.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Slide com anima\xe7\xe3o. Repare que o ret\xe2ngulo lil\xe1s tem uma anima\xe7\xe3o (ele deveria aparecer apenas depois do clique). N\xe3o d\xe1 para replicar isso no Modo de Edi\xe7\xe3o. A \xe1rea lil\xe1s aparece vis\xedvel o tempo todo (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-3.png" alt="Slide com anima\xe7\xe3o. Repare que o ret\xe2ngulo lil\xe1s tem uma anima\xe7\xe3o (ele deveria aparecer apenas depois do clique). N\xe3o d\xe1 para replicar isso no Modo de Edi\xe7\xe3o. A \xe1rea lil\xe1s aparece vis\xedvel o tempo todo" width="1028" height="534" border="0" /></a> Ent\xe3o, qual o meio-termo? Simples: Se voc\xea pudesse abrir o Modo de Exibi\xe7\xe3o do Apresentador <strong>sem entrar em Modo de Apresenta\xe7\xe3o</strong> (ou seja, sem abrir a apresenta\xe7\xe3o em tela cheia no outro monitor), ter\xedamos o melhor dos mundo: <ul> <li>As miniaturas estariam \xe0 disposi\xe7\xe3o; e</li> <li>As anima\xe7\xf5es funcionariam.</li> </ul> A boa not\xedcia \xe9 que fazer isso \xe9 mais f\xe1cil do que voc\xea imagina. Ao iniciar uma apresenta\xe7\xe3o, ao inv\xe9s de F5 tecle <code>Alt-F5</code>. Simples assim! <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image-4.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="PowerPoint com a tela compartilhada em Modo de Exibi\xe7\xe3o de Apresentador (Presenter View). \xc9 poss\xedvel ver o slide atual com suas anima\xe7\xf5es (1), o pr\xf3ximo slide e/ou anima\xe7\xe3o (2), notas de slide (3) e acessar a tela com todas as miniaturas (4) (clique para ampliar)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-4.png" alt="PowerPoint com a tela compartilhada em Modo de Exibi\xe7\xe3o de Apresentador (Presenter View). \xc9 poss\xedvel ver o slide atual com suas anima\xe7\xf5es (1), o pr\xf3ximo slide e/ou anima\xe7\xe3o (2), notas de slide (3) e acessar a tela com todas as miniaturas (4)" width="1028" height="577" border="0" /></a> E a\xed, conhecia este truque? Tem algum outro truque que voc\xea usa quando faz apresenta\xe7\xf5es no PowerPoint pela internet? N\xe3o deixe de compartilhar.', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-4.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/11/01/como-exibir-apresentacoes-do-powerpoint-num-unico-monitor/', 'date': u'2016-11-01 17:59:20', 'slug': u'como-exibir-apresentacoes-do-powerpoint-num-unico-monitor', 'title': u'Como exibir apresenta\xe7\xf5es do PowerPoint num \xfanico monitor', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Dicas'], u'post_translations': [u'ab47dc0f-faba-411b-88ff-6d250b11d8de'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'PowerPoint']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'17721', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-4.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Have you ever needed to do a PowerPoint presentation by Skype, Hangout or the like? Although both become very easy to share the screen and show the PowerPoint window, the experience falls short of the ideal. But there&#39;s a trick that makes it that much better! <!--more--> If you use PowerPoint very often to do live performances, using a projector, you&#39;ve probably noticed that he is very &quot;smart&quot; and a few cool tricks when you press F5. But specifically: <ul> <li>It automatically changes the mode of two duplicate Windows screens for extended;</li> <li>On the main screen (on your computer/notebook) it opens the window of the presenter view (P<em>resenter View</em>);</li> <li>On secondary screen (projector) he puts the presentation in full screen.</li> </ul> Cool, huh? Only when our presentation will be online, via Skype or Hangout, this behavior is not so cool. If you press F5 to display a PPT during its webcast or meeting, you will come across one of these problems, depending on your configuration: <ol> <li><strong>If you have only one monitor: </strong>PowerPoint will display the presentation in full screen, which makes it harder to control the presentation, because you can&#39;t see the thumbnails of the PowerPoint slides;</li> <li><strong>If you have more than one monito</strong>r: PowerPoint will try to be &quot;smart&quot; and play the presentation on the second monitor. The problem is that this typically involves changes in resolution (sometimes even of DPI), not to mention the fact that the presentation changes from monitor. Skype and can be fine Hangout confused when this kind of change happens during a screen sharing!</li> </ol> So, normally I see people do is just let the PowerPoint open in edit mode and share your window: <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image-2.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="PowerPoint in edit mode, with the screen being shared in the Skype for Business (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-2.png" alt="PowerPoint in edit mode, with the screen being shared in the Skype for Business" width="1028" height="550" border="0" /></a> <dl> <dd><strong>About uploading presentation</strong>s: some of the online meeting services such as Skype for Business, allow you to upload of your PPTs before the meeting and use the features of the tool (and not PowerPoint) to control the presentation. Yes, this would be a solution to this problem, it wasn&#39;t the fact that (1) not all services offer this facility and (2) that the offer, doesn&#39;t always work.</dd> </dl> This brings up, however, another problem: in the edit mode the animations do not work, so the experience for the audience falls short of the desired: <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image-3.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="Slide with animation. Note that the purple rectangle has an animation (it should appear only after click). You can&#39;t replicate it in edit mode. The purple area appears visible all the time (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-3.png" alt="Slide with animation. Note that the purple rectangle has an animation (it should appear only after click). You can&#39;t replicate it in edit mode. The purple area appears visible all the time" width="1028" height="534" border="0" /></a> So, what&#39;s the middle ground? Simple: If you could open the presenter view without going into<strong> presentation mode (i.e. without </strong>opening the presentation in full screen on the other monitor), we&#39;d have the best of the world: <ul> <li>The thumbnails would be available; and</li> <li>The animations work.</li> </ul> The good news is that doing so is easier than you think. When you start a presentation, instead of F5 press<code> Alt-F</code>5. Simple as that! <a href="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image-4.png"><img style="background-image: none; padding-top: 0px; padding-left: 0px; display: inline; padding-right: 0px; border-width: 0px;" title="PowerPoint with the shared screen in Presenter view (Presenter View). You can view the current slide with your animations (1), the next slide and/or animation (2), (3) slide notes and access the screen with all the thumbnails (4) (click to enlarge)" src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-4.png" alt="PowerPoint with the shared screen in Presenter view (Presenter View). You can view the current slide with your animations (1), the next slide and/or animation (2), (3) slide notes and access the screen with all the thumbnails (4)" width="1028" height="577" border="0" /></a> And there, I knew this trick? Is there any other trick that you use when you do PowerPoint presentations over the internet? Be sure to share.', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-2.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-3.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-4.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/11/01/as-view-presentations-of-powerpoint-a-single-monitor/', 'date': u'2016-11-01 17:59:20', 'slug': u'as-view-presentations-of-powerpoint-a-single-monitor', 'title': u'How to display PowerPoint presentations on a single monitor', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Tips'], u'post_translations': [u'ab47dc0f-faba-411b-88ff-6d250b11d8de'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'17921', 'type': u'post'}

Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/image_thumb-4.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Hoje foi <a href="https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/stevengu/2016/11/03/announcing-the-mvp-reconnect-program-the-2016-mvp-global-summit/" target="_blank">anunciado</a> um marco importante na hist\xf3ria do Programa MVP da Microsoft: o MVP Reconnect. O MVP Reconnect \xe9 uma iniciativa para trazer de volta para perto do programa os ex-MVPs \u2013 aqueles que n\xe3o foram renovados ou que viraram funcion\xe1rios Microsoft e, portanto, perderam o direito ao pr\xeamio.<!--more--> <h2>MVP Reconnect</h2> Ao longo dos anos, a Microsoft vem recebendo feedback de antigos MVPs que estavam procurando maneiras de permanecer em contato com o programa e com seus pares. Isso porque, uma vez que um MVP sa\xeda do programa, ele n\xe3o tinha mais um ve\xedculo \u201coficial\u201d para se manter em contato com a Microsoft. Sua \xfanica op\xe7\xe3o seria voltar a ser nomeado como MVP. Esse feedback deixou clara a necessidade de acolher os MVPs que deixavam o programa ap\xf3s anos e anos de dedica\xe7\xe3o \xe0 comunidade t\xe9cnica Microsoft. Da\xed surgiu o <strong>MVP Reconnect</strong>. O MVP Reconnect \xe9 uma extens\xe3o do compromisso da Microsoft com o programa MVP e \xe9, ao mesmo tempo, uma outra forma de reconhecer a experi\xeancia e o envolvimento das pessoas que contribuem para as comunidades t\xe9cnicas. O objetivo primordial do programa \xe9 permitir que antigos MVPs mantenham-se em contato com a Microsoft, atrav\xe9s de um canal direto e com o devido suporte, mesmo n\xe3o sendo membros ativos do Programa MVP. Uma outra forma de entender de onde surgiu o programa MVP Reconnect \xe9 atrav\xe9s de uma analogia: <blockquote>A id\xe9ia por tr\xe1s do programa pode ser melhor descrita com uma analogia de outra ind\xfastria; Os Oscars s\xe3o um dos pr\xeamios mais reconhecidos e prestigiados na ind\xfastria cinematogr\xe1fica. A partir do momento em que algu\xe9m ganha seu primeiro Oscar, ele se tornam parte de uma comunidade muito especial - a dos vencedores do Oscar - e eles pertencem a esta comunidade para sempre, mesmo que eles n\xe3o ganhem um pr\xeamio a cada ano. O mesmo se aplica aos MVPs: uma vez MVP, sempre parte da comunidade MVP!</blockquote> O site oficial do Programa Reconnect tem mais informa\xe7\xf5es a respeito do programa. Aqueles MVPs que n\xe3o est\xe3o ativos no Programa MVP ser\xe3o convidados a participar do Reconnect. Os convites ser\xe3o enviados aos poucos, portanto se voc\xea \xe9 um ex-MVP e gostaria de se juntar ao MVP Reconnect, <a href="https://mvp.microsoft.com/en-us/Pages/reconnect-requestform" target="_blank">inscreva-se agora</a>! <h2>Conclus\xe3o</h2> Uma vez MVP, sempre MVP. Essa iniciativa de se reaproximar dos antigos MVPs \xe9, na minha opini\xe3o, uma tremenda \u201cbola dentro\u201d da Microsoft. J\xe1 n\xe3o era sem tempo! E voc\xea, o que achou do novo programa? N\xe3o deixe de comentar! &nbsp; Um abra\xe7o, Igor Para saber mais: <ul> <li><a href="https://mvp.microsoft.com/en-us/Pages/reconnect-whatis">The MVP Reconnect story</a></li> </ul>', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': [], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2016/11/03/conhea-o-novo-mvp-reconnect/', 'date': u'2016-11-03 22:11:03', 'slug': u'conhea-o-novo-mvp-reconnect', 'title': u'Conhe\xe7a o novo MVP Reconnect', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'An\xfancios'], u'post_translations': [u'f481815d-6ac8-40e1-970e-9b4f5fb8abba'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'MVP', u'MVP Reconnect']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'17961', 'type': u'post'}

.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Today it <a href="https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/stevengu/2016/11/03/announcing-the-mvp-reconnect-program-the-2016-mvp-global-summit/" target="_blank">was announ</a>ced an important milestone in the history of the Microsoft MVP Program: MVP Reconnect. MVP Reconnect is an initiative to bring back to near the ex-MVPs programme \u2013 those that have not been renewed or turned to Microsoft employees and therefore lost the right to the prize.<!--more--> <h2>MVP Reconnect</h2> Over the years, Microsoft has received feedback from former MVPs who were looking for ways to stay in touch with the program and with their peers. This is because, once an MVP left the program, he no longer had an &quot;official&quot; vehicle to keep in touch with the Microsoft. Your only option would be to go back to being named as MVP. This feedback made clear the need to accommodate the MVPs that left the program after years and years of dedication to the Microsoft technical community. Hence the M<strong>VP Reconnect</strong>. MVP Reconnect is an extension of Microsoft&#39;s commitment with the MVP program and is, at the same time, another way to recognize the experience and involvement of people who contribute to technical communities. The primary objective of the program is to allow former MVPs keep in touch with Microsoft, through a direct channel and with the proper support, even if it&#39;s not active members of the MVP Program. Another way to understand where the MVP program Reconnect through an analogy: <blockquote>The idea behind the program may be best described with an analogy to other industry; The Oscars are one of the most recognized and prestigious awards in the film industry. As soon as someone wins his first Oscar, he become part of a very special community-the Oscar winners-and they belong to this community forever, even if they don&#39;t win a prize each year. The same applies to MVPs: MVP, always part of the community MVP!</blockquote> The official website of the Reconnect Program has more information about the program. Those MVPs who are not active in the MVP Program will be invited to participate in the Reconnect. The invitations will be sent, so if you&#39;re a former MVP and would like to join the MVP Reconne<a href="https://mvp.microsoft.com/en-us/Pages/reconnect-requestform" target="_blank">ct, sign up now</a>! <h2>Conclusion</h2> Once always MVP MVP. This initiative of if reconnect of former MVPs is, in my opinion, a tremendous ball inside &quot;from Microsoft. It&#39;s about time! And you, what did you think of the new program? Be sure to comment! A hug, Igor To learn more: <ul> <li><a href="https://mvp.microsoft.com/en-us/Pages/reconnect-whatis">The MVP Reconnect story</a></li> </ul>', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': [], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2016/11/03/meet-the-new-mvp-reconnect/', 'date': u'2016-11-03 22:11:03', 'slug': u'meet-the-new-mvp-reconnect', 'title': u'Meet the new MVP Reconnect', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Announcements'], u'post_translations': [u'f481815d-6ac8-40e1-970e-9b4f5fb8abba'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'18001', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2016-11/meet-the-new-mvp-reconnect/2016-11-03-Post.md
.{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'J\xe1 aconteceu com voc\xea de compartilhar a internet 3G/4G do seu celular com o seu notebook Windows 10, s\xf3 para descobrir que em poucas horas (\xe0s vezes, em meros minutos) ele consumiu toda a sua franquia mensal de dados? Bem, a boa not\xedcia \xe9 que d\xe1 para evitar. Saiba como. <!--more--> A motiva\xe7\xe3o deste post veio de uma discuss\xe3o sobre uma <a href="https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2017/01/09/announcing-windows-10-insider-preview-build-15002-pc/#XVMxrXTSbmbpiImY.97" target="top">not\xedcia</a> - a de que a partir de agora seria poss\xedvel pausar as atualiza\xe7\xf5es do Windows 10 por at\xe9 35 dias. O cerne da discuss\xe3o foi <em>"mas por que algu\xe9m iria querer pausar os updates?"</em> Um dos motivos citados foi poder controlar o consumo de banda de internet do Windows 10 - liberando o download de updates apenas no momento em que fosse mais conveniente. Com isso voc\xea poderia, por exemplo, postergar o update enquanto est\xe1 na rua, liberando-o apenas quando conectasse o notebook \xe0 rede da sua casa ou do trabalho. Foi quando algu\xe9m comentou: <blockquote>Ele [o Windows 10] j\xe1 esperto o suficiente pra n\xe3o baixar em conex\xf5es de celular, e se n\xe3o h\xe1 banda, pra n\xe3o tomar a banda toda.</blockquote> E outra pessoa retrucou de imediato: <blockquote>N\xe3o, ele n\xe3o \xe9. Quando eu compartilhei minha conex\xe3o do android que eu tinha com o computador da (minha esposa) ele conseguiu baixar 2gb em meia hora com atualiza\xe7\xe3o.</blockquote> Afinal, o Windows sabe ou n\xe3o reduzir o tr\xe1fego de dados quando se conecta a um celular? <h2>Vamos aos fatos</h2> Indiscutivelmente o Windows 10 foi feito pensando em PCs com conex\xf5es ilimitadas de Internet e, normalmente, ele usa o m\xe1ximo da sua banda de download e upload que ele puder. Para evitar esse comportamento, desde o Windows 8 a Microsoft introduziu o conceito de Conex\xf5es Limitadas (<em>Metered Connections</em> em ingl\xeas). <a href="https://support.microsoft.com/pt-br/instantanswers/633571e5-3591-437d-bf6a-071a243305a7/metered-connections-in-windows-10" target="top">Conex\xf5es Limitadas</a> servem para indicar ao Windows que existe algum limite de dados numa conex\xe3o de Internet e, portanto, ele deve reduzir ao m\xe1ximo seu tr\xe1fego de dados. \xc9 assim que limitamos o consumo de dados quando nos conectamos ao 3G de um celular. Como consequ\xeancia, quando marcamos uma conex\xe3o como limitada, temos uma mudan\xe7a de comportamento no Windows: <ul> <li><strong>Download de atualiza\xe7\xf5es \xe9 interrompido</strong>. O Windows n\xe3o faz download de atualiza\xe7\xf5es do Windows Update em segundo plano quando ele est\xe1 conectado a uma conex\xe3o limitada;</li> <li><strong>Atualiza\xe7\xe3o de apps \xe9 interrompido</strong>. As atualiza\xe7\xf5es autom\xe1ticas de apps da Windows Store s\xe3o interrompidas. Entretanto, isto se aplica apenas \xe0 Windows Store. Aplica\xe7\xf5es desktop "antigas", que cuidem se seu pr\xf3prio processo de atualiza\xe7\xe3o (como o Google Chrome) podem n\xe3o respeitar essa configura\xe7\xe3o.</li> <li><strong>Compartilhamento ponto-a-ponto de atualiza\xe7\xf5es \xe9 interrompido</strong>. O Windows 10 trouxe uma novidade no processo de download de atualiza\xe7\xf5es do Windows Update. At\xe9 o Windows 8, os downloads eram sempre feito exclusivamente a partir de servidores da Microsoft. A partir do Windows 10, as atualiza\xe7\xf5es podem vir do computador de outros usu\xe1rios pr\xf3ximos a voc\xea que j\xe1 tenham baixado aquele pacote (\xe9 como se fosse um "<strong>BitTorrent de Updates</strong>"). Voc\xea n\xe3o percebe, mas pode estar compartilhando pequenos peda\xe7os de pacotes de atualiza\xe7\xe3o o tempo todo enquanto est\xe1 conectado \xe0 Internet. Em conex\xf5es limitadas, isso n\xe3o acontece.</li> <li><strong>Atualiza\xe7\xe3o de Live Tiles \xe9 reduzida (ou suspensa)</strong>. As atualiza\xe7\xf5es das Live Tiles ("blocos din\xe2micos") do Windows 10 podem depender de <em>push notifications</em> vindas da internet. Nesses casos, para reduzir o tr\xe1fego gerado por essas notifica\xe7\xf5es, as atualiza\xe7\xf5es que v\xeam da internet s\xe3o reduzidas e/ou suspensas.</li> <li><strong>Aplicativos podem se comportar de maneira distinta</strong>. Aplicativos "bem-comportados" podem consultar o status da conex\xe3o de rede atual e, ao perceberem que est\xe3o numa conex\xe3o limitada, reduzir ou mesmo suspender o tr\xe1fego de rede. Esse tipo de comportamento \xe9 mais comum em apps "modernas" (<a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/pt-br/windows/uwp/get-started/whats-a-uwp" target="top">UWP</a>), mas apps desktop tamb\xe9m podem seguir o exemplo. O Outlook (2013 em diante) \xe9 uma dessas apps desktop que respeita uma conex\xe3o limitada:</li> </ul> <img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg" alt="Outlook com a barra indicadora de conex\xe3o limitada. Ele n\xe3o ir\xe1 baixar emails a menos que voc\xea clique no bot\xe3o &quot;Connect anyway&quot;" /> Ok, agora que sabemos que \xe9 poss\xedvel indicar ao Windows que estamos conectados a uma rede limitada e que, portanto, ele n\xe3o deve "destruir" nossa internet, falta aprendermos <strong>como</strong> definir uma conex\xe3o como limitada. <h2>Configurando uma Conex\xe3o Limitada</h2> Primeiramente, conecte-se \xe0 internet usando a internet do seu celular do jeito que voc\xea est\xe1 acostumado. <strong>IMPORTANTE</strong>: Conex\xf5es limitadas somente se aplicam a rede <strong>WiFi</strong> e <strong>M\xf3veis</strong>. A seguir, clique no <em>fly-out</em> de redes do Windows (o \xedcone de WiFi na barra de tarefas do Windows), selecione a conex\xe3o com o seu celular e clique em <strong>Properties</strong>: <img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularFlyOut-Properties-1.png" alt="Menu de conex\xf5es do Windows, com uma conex\xe3o de celular selecionada. Clique no link Properties para alterar a configura\xe7\xe3o de Conex\xe3o Limitada" /> Por fim, na janela de configura\xe7\xf5es da conex\xe3o, ative a op\xe7\xe3o de Conex\xe3o Limitada ("<em>metered connection</em>"): <img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png" alt="Janela de configura\xe7\xe3o de rede do Windows, com a op\xe7\xe3o de Conex\xe3o Limitada (&quot;Metered Connection&quot;) em destaque" /> Pronto! Agora o Windows vai saber que esta \xe9 uma conex\xe3o limitada e vai reduzir o consumo de dados sempre que estiver conectado a essa rede. <h2>Afinal, o Windows \xe9 "esperto" ou n\xe3o?</h2> De volta \xe0 discuss\xe3o que deu origem a este post. O primeiro coment\xe1rio disse que o Windows era esperto o bastante para n\xe3o baixar atualiza\xe7\xf5es quando conectado ao celular, ao passo que o segundo discordou com evid\xeancias de que o Windows tinha sim baixado dois gigas de updates. A verdade, por incr\xedvel que pare\xe7a, \xe9 que os dois est\xe3o certos. :-) O que aconteceu \xe9 que os dois se conectaram \xe0 internet 3G do celular de maneiras diferentes. Veja: <ul> <li>No caso de redes m\xf3veis <strong>conectadas diretamente ao Windows</strong>, seja atrav\xe9s de modems 3G/4G USB ou naqueles port\xe1teis que j\xe1 v\xeam com suporte a 3G de f\xe1brica (basta instalar um chip no PC), o SO realmente \xe9 "esperto" e configura automaticamente a rede como limitada.</li> <li>Entretanto, o mesmo n\xe3o se aplica a conex\xf5es por WiFi (via compartilhamento de internet de telefones celulares). Isso porque o Windows n\xe3o tem como saber se aquele <em>access point</em> \xe9 um WiFi "normal", conectado a uma internet de banda larga, ou um hotspot de um celular. Por isso, ele simplesmente assume que \xe9 um WiFi ilimitado. Nestes casos, sempre que voc\xea se conectar a um hotspot 3G por WiFi \xe9 <strong>fundamental</strong> que voc\xea habilite a conex\xe3o limitada manualmente.</li> </ul> Vale lembrar que o Windows persiste a configura\xe7\xe3o de conex\xe3o ilimitada para as suas redes WiFi. Assim, se voc\xea nomear sua rede WiFi do hotpost com um nome espec\xedfico o suficiente (no meu caso, meu hotspot se chama <em>LG G4 do Igor</em>), basta fazer a configura\xe7\xe3o na <strong>primeira vez</strong> que se conectar a essa rede. Das pr\xf3ximas vezes, ele vai lembrar e manter a conex\xe3o como limitada. E o melhor: Como as configura\xe7\xf5es de WiFi s\xe3o salvas na nuvem (desde que voc\xea habilite a sincroniza\xe7\xe3o de configura\xe7\xf5es do Windows), mesmo que voc\xea formate o computador e reinstale o Windows ele ainda vai se lembrar da configura\xe7\xe3o de rede limitada! E a\xed, o que achou do post? Conhecia o recurso de conex\xf5es limitadas do Windows? Deixe seu coment\xe1rio! Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularFlyOut-Properties-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2017/01/13/evite-que-o-windows-10-acabe-com-a-franquia-de-dados-do-seu-celular/', 'date': u'2017-01-13 20:00:40', 'slug': u'evite-que-o-windows-10-acabe-com-a-franquia-de-dados-do-seu-celular', 'title': u'Evite que o Windows 10 acabe com a franquia de dados do seu celular', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Dicas'], u'post_translations': [u'919e31a5-958b-4639-b903-841c3aadfb82'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas'], u'post_tag': [u'Internet', u'Mobile Hotspot', u'Windows 10']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'18181', 'type': u'post'}

URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg... Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Ever happened to you to share the 3 g/4 g internet from your mobile phone with your Windows notebook 10, only to find that in a few hours (sometimes in mere minutes) he used up all his monthly franchise? Well, the good news is that you can avoid. Learn how. <!--more--> The motivation for this post came from a discussion<a href="https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2017/01/09/announcing-windows-10-insider-preview-build-15002-pc/#XVMxrXTSbmbpiImY.97" target="top"> about</a> a news-that from now on it would be possible to pause Windows updates 10 for up to 35 days. The crux of the discussio<em>n was &quot;but why would anyone want to pause updates?&quot;</em> One of the reasons cited was able to control the internet bandwidth consumption of Windows 10-releasing download updates only in the moment in which it was more convenient. With it you could, for example, delay the update while you&#39;re on the street, releasing him only when you connect the laptop to the network in your home or work. That&#39;s when someone commented: <blockquote>He&#39;s[o Windows 10] already smart enough to not download in mobile connections, and if there is no band, not to take the whole band.</blockquote> And someone else replied immediately: <blockquote>No, he&#39;s not. When I shared my android connection that I had with the computer on (my wife) he managed to download 2 GB in half an hour with update.</blockquote> After all, Windows knows or not to reduce the data traffic when it connects to a cell phone? <h2>Let&#39;s get down to brass tacks</h2> Arguably the Windows 10 was made thinking on PCs with unlimited Internet connections and, typically, it uses as much of your download and upload that he can. To avoid this behavior, since the Windows 8 Microsoft introduced the concept of Limited Connections (Me<em>tered Connections </em>in English). <a href="https://support.microsoft.com/pt-br/instantanswers/633571e5-3591-437d-bf6a-071a243305a7/metered-connections-in-windows-10" target="top">Limited connectio</a>ns serve to indicate to the Windows there is a data limit in a Internet connection and, therefore, it must reduce the most of your data traffic. That&#39;s how we restrict data consumption when we connect to a 3 g phone. As a result, when we set a connection as limited, we have a change in behavior in Windows: <ul> <li><strong>Download of updates is interrupted</strong>. Windows will not download updates from Windows Update in the background when it is connected to a limited connection;</li> <li><strong>Updating apps is interrupted</strong>. Automatic updates of Windows apps Store are interrupted. However, this applies only to the Windows Store. &quot;Old&quot; desktop applications, to take care if his own update process (like Google Chrome) may not respect this setting.</li> <li><strong>Peer-to-peer sharing of updates is interrupted</strong>. Windows 10 brought something new in the process of downloading updates from Windows Update. Until Windows 8, the downloads were made exclusively from Microsoft servers. From Windows, 10 updates can come from other computer users near you who have already downloaded that package (it&#39;s like a &quot;B<strong>itTorrent Updates</strong>&quot;). You don&#39;t realize, but you can be sharing tiny bits of update packages all the time while you&#39;re connected to the Internet. Limited connections, it does not.</li> <li><strong>Update of Live Tiles is reduced (or suspended)</strong>. Updates of Live Tiles (&quot;dynamic blocks&quot;) of Windows 10 may depend on pus<em>h notifications </em>from the internet. In these cases, to reduce the traffic generated by these notifications, updates that come from the internet are reduced and/or suspended.</li> <li><strong>Applications can behave in a different way</strong>. &quot;Well-behaved&quot; applications can query the status of the current network connection, and to realize that they&#39;re in a limited connection, reduce or even suspend the network traffic. This type of behavior is more common in &quot;modern&quot; app<a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/pt-br/windows/uwp/get-started/whats-a-uwp" target="top">s (</a>UWP), but desktop apps can also follow suit. Outlook (2013 onwards) is one of those desktop apps as far as a limited connection:</li> </ul> <img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg" alt="Outlook with limited connection indicator bar. It will not download emails unless you click &quot;Connect anyway&quot;" /> OK, now that we know that it is possible to indicate to the Windows that we are connected to a network limited and, therefore, he should not &quot;destroy&quot; our internet, Miss lear<strong>n ho</strong>w to define a connection as limited. <h2>Configuring a connection Limited</h2> First, connect to the internet using the internet from your mobile phone the way you&#39;re used to. <strong>IMPORTANT:</strong> limited Connections only apply to WiFi network<strong> and</strong> fu<strong>rnitur</strong>e. Next, click the fl<em>y-out </em>Windows networks (WiFi icon on the taskbar of Windows), select the connection with your phone, and then click <strong>Properties</strong>: <img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularFlyOut-Properties-1.png" alt="The connections menu Windows, with a selected cellular connection. Click Properties to change the setting of limited connection" /> Finally, in the connection settings window, activate the option of limited connection (<em>&quot;metered connectio</em>n&quot;): <img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png" alt="Network configuration window of Windows, with the option of limited connection (&quot;Metered Connection&quot;) highlights" /> Ready! Now Windows will know that this is a limited connection and will reduce the consumption of data whenever you are connected to this network. <h2>After all, Windows is &quot;smart&quot; or not?</h2> Back to the discussion that led to this post. The first comment said that Windows was smart enough not to download updates when connected to the cell phone, while the second disagreed with evidence that the Windows had downloaded two gigs of updates. The truth, oddly enough, is that both are right. :-) What happened is that the two have connected to the internet 3 g phone in different ways. See: <ul> <li>In the case of mobile ne<strong>tworks connected directly to Wind</strong>ows, either through 3 g/4 g USB modems or those laptops that now come with 3 g support of factory (just install a chip in the PC), the OS really is &quot;smart&quot; and automatically configures the network as limited.</li> <li>However, the same does not apply to connections over WiFi (via internet sharing to mobile phones). That&#39;s because Windows has no way of knowing if t<em>hat is a WiF</em>i access point &quot;normal&quot;, connected to a broadband internet or a hotspot of a cell phone. So, he simply assumes that is an unlimited WiFi. In these cases, whenever you connect to a 3 g WiFi hotspot it is <strong>essential </strong>that you enable the limited connection manually.</li> </ul> Remember that Windows Setup unlimited connection persists for their WiFi networks. So, if you name your WiFi network with a specific name hotpost enough (in my case, my hotspot is called LG G<em>4 of Igor), </em>just do the configuration the f<strong>irst time y</strong>ou connect to that network. The next time he will remember and keep the connection as limited. And the best: As the WiFi settings are saved in the cloud (as long as you enable synchronization of Windows settings) even if you format the computer and reinstall Windows it still will remember the limited network configuration. So, what did you think of the post? Knew the limited connections feature of Windows? Leave your comment! A hug, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularFlyOut-Properties-1.png', 'https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/en/2017/01/13/avoid-windows-10-finish-the-franchise-of-your-mobile-data/', 'date': u'2017-01-13 20:00:40', 'slug': u'avoid-windows-10-finish-the-franchise-of-your-mobile-data', 'title': u'Avoid Windows 10 finish the franchise of your mobile data', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'Tips'], u'post_translations': [u'919e31a5-958b-4639-b903-841c3aadfb82'], u'language': [u'English']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'18541', 'type': u'post'}
build/jekyll/www.tshooter.com.br/_posts/2017-01/avoid-windows-10-finish-the-franchise-of-your-mobile-data/2017-01-13-Post.md
URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularOutlook-metered-network-warning-570x360-4.jpg... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularFlyOut-Properties-1.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularFlyOut-Properties-1.png... URL Parse: https|www.tshooter.com.br|/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png|||
Downloading https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Evite-que-o-Windows-10-acabe-com-sua-franquia-de-celularMetered-Connection-1.png....{'status': u'publish', 'body': u'Mais um post da s\xe9rie "<em>causos de ALM nos cliente Lambda3</em>". De um lado, os desenvolvedores querendo ter acesso irrestrito ao NuGet (<a href="http://www.nuget.org" target="top">www.nuget.org</a>) por raz\xf5es \xf3bvias. De outro lado, o pessoal respons\xe1vel por seguran\xe7a e infraestrutura preocupados com o risco de liberar o acesso irrestrito ao NuGet no firewall. #comofaz? <!--more--> <h2>O problema</h2> O grande desafio encontrado neste caso - que, ali\xe1s, \xe9 comum \xe0 maioria de nossos clientes - \xe9 <strong>como equilibrar entre a conveni\xeancia para os desenvolvedores e a seguran\xe7a para a empresa</strong>? Mais especificamente: a pol\xedtica de firewall da empresa em quest\xe3o prev\xea, entre outras coisas, <em>whitelisting</em> de IPs que podem ser acessados a partir de sua rede interna. Em outras palavras, \xe9 preciso liberar um determinado <em>range</em> de IPs para que eles possam ser acessados. Entretanto, em tempos de <em>cloud computing</em> e de endere\xe7os IPv4 esgotados, est\xe1 cada vez dif\xedcil sustentar esta estrat\xe9gia. Isso porque \xe9 cada vez mais comum que provedores de servi\xe7o mudem os IPs de seus servi\xe7os com uma certa frequ\xeancia, contando com os servi\xe7os de DNS para notificar os clientes quando tais mudan\xe7as acontecem. No caso do NuGet, isso quer dizer que os IPs dos <em>endpoints</em> de servi\xe7o do NuGet podem mudar. Veja o resultado atual (consultado no dia da publica\xe7\xe3o deste post) do DNS lookup para um dos dom\xednios do NuGet: <pre><code class="language-sh">C:\\&gt; nslookup api.nuget.org Server: *************** Address: ***.***.***.*** Non-authoritative answer: Name: cs9.wpc.v0cdn.net Addresses: 2606:2800:157:1508:1539:174:1a75:1191 192.16.48.200 Aliases: api.nuget.org db16.wpc.azureedge.net </code></pre> Viu como o dom\xednio api.nuget.org \xe9, na verdade, um <em>alias</em> (ou <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNAME_record" target="top">CNAME</a>) para um <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_delivery_network" target="top">CDN</a>? Isso quer dizer que n\xe3o h\xe1 nenhuma garantia de que o IP retornado por <code>api.nuget.org</code> vai ser sempre <code>192.16.48.200</code>. Pelo contr\xe1rio - a natureza din\xe2mica dos CDN \xe9 quase uma <strong>certeza</strong> de que esse IP vai mudar em algum momento. Portanto, uma libera\xe7\xe3o baseada em IPs n\xe3o resolve. Neste caso, qual a alternativa? <h2>Solu\xe7\xf5es</h2> Obviamente precisamos de uma alternativa. Principalmente porque, no caso deste cliente, ele nos perguntou explicitamente: <blockquote>Como outros clientes de voc\xea atuam nesta situa\xe7\xe3o?</blockquote> Bem, deixe-me compartilhar com voc\xeas o que andamos vendo em nossos clientes: <h3>Acesso irrestrito a *.nuget.org</h3> Sim, \xe9 claro que esta \xe9 uma op\xe7\xe3o v\xe1lida - ainda que pouco desej\xe1vel em muitos de nossos clientes, que ficam desconfort\xe1veis com acesso irrestrito \xe0 internet. Entretanto, esta \xe9 uma op\xe7\xe3o relativamente comum, em especial naqueles clientes que n\xe3o podem (ou n\xe3o querem) ter o <em>overhead</em> de gerenciar o acesso ao NuGet. Afinal, limita\xe7\xf5es de acesso aqui podem impactar diretamente na produtividade dos desenvolvedores. Se voc\xea n\xe3o se quiser liberar todos os dom\xednios abaixo de nuget.org (<code>*.nuget.org</code>), pode liberar apenas estes dois: <ul> <li><code>www.nuget.org</code> (HTTP, HTTPS);</li> <li><code>api.nuget.org</code> (HTTP, HTTPS).</li> </ul> O maior inconveniente dessa abordagem (segundo alguns de nossos clientes) \xe9 que o acesso precisa ser dado <strong>para todo mundo</strong>: desenvolvedores, agentes de build e release, servidores... Todo mundo pode precisar acessar o NuGet.org. Ser\xe1 que n\xe3o tem um meio-termo? <h3>Servidor <em>proxy</em> de NuGet</h3> Sim, h\xe1 um meio-termo. Com um servidor de proxy de NuGet (usamos o <a href="www.inedo.com/proget" target="top">ProGet</a> em alguns de nossos clientes), n\xe3o h\xe1 a necessidade de liberar o acesso ao NuGet.org para todo mundo. Apenas o servidor de ProGet precisa ter acesso irrestrito ao NuGet.org. Quando voc\xea configura um servidor ProGet interno, <strong>ele</strong> \xe9 quem baixa os pacotes do NuGet.org para voc\xea - por isso \xe9 que ele \xe9 um "<em>proxy</em>" do NuGet. Isso implica em uma mudan\xe7a na configura\xe7\xe3o do NuGet na m\xe1quina dos desenvolvedores. No Visual Studio de cada desenvolvedor, v\xe1 em Tools | Options, selecione a p\xe1gina <strong>Package Sources</strong> da configura\xe7\xe3o do NuGet e fa\xe7a duas coisas: <ul> <li>Inclua o endere\xe7o do feed do seu proxy (<code>http://proget/nuget/default</code> no meu exemplo); e</li> <li>Desabilite os outros feeds de acesso ao NuGet p\xfablico.</li> </ul> <img src="http://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/NugetSettingsDialog.png" alt="Caixa de di\xe1logo de configura\xe7\xe3o do Visual Studio, na p\xe1gina &quot;Package Sources&quot;, com um feed personalizado apontando para um servidor ProGet interno e os outros feeds desabilitados" /> Caso voc\xea queira evitar de fazer esse processo de configra\xe7\xe3o "na m\xe3o", pode ao inv\xe9s disso atualizar o arquivo de configura\xe7\xe3o do NuGet de cada desenvolvedor (por padr\xe3o, fica em <code>C:\\Users\\&lt;nome do usu\xe1rio&gt;\\AppData\\Roaming\\NuGet\\nuget.config</code>), seguindo o exemplo abaixo: <pre><code class="language-xml">&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt; &lt;configuration&gt; &lt;packageSources&gt; &lt;add key="Package source" value="http://proget/nuget/default" /&gt; &lt;add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" /&gt; &lt;/packageSources&gt; &lt;disabledPackageSources&gt; &lt;add key="nuget.org" value="true" /&gt; &lt;add key="Microsoft and .NET" value="true" /&gt; &lt;add key="Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages" value="true" /&gt; &lt;/disabledPackageSources&gt; &lt;/configuration&gt; </code></pre> Um benef\xedcio adicional, do ponto de vista de seguran\xe7a, \xe9 que o ProGet permite fazer a "curadoria" dos pacotes - ou seja, \xe9 poss\xedvel aprovar/reprovar pacotes que aparecem \xe0 disposi\xe7\xe3o dos desenvolvedores. Com isso, as empresas acabam com uma alternativa ainda mais segura: o inv\xe9s de barrar/liberar o NuGet.org como um todo, podem fazer isso seletivamente - pacote a pacote, se necess\xe1rio. <blockquote> <h3><i class="fa fa-info-circle"></i> Importante</h3> O recurso de proxy de feeds do ProGet n\xe3o est\xe1 dispon\xedvel na vers\xe3o gratuita. Para mais detalhes, visite <a href="http://inedo.com/proget/pricing" target="top">http://inedo.com/proget/pricing</a></blockquote> <h3>Libera\xe7\xe3o por IP</h3> Bom, se ainda assim nada der certo e voc\xea precisar fazer a libera\xe7\xe3o por IP, resta um problema: Como saber se/quando os IPs do nuget.org mudaram? Uma alternativa \xe9 criar um script e execut\xe1-lo de tempos em tempos, a fim de verificar se os IPs mudaram ou n\xe3o (visto que n\xe3o h\xe1 um <em>feed</em> oficial com essa finalidade). Como ponto de partida, voc\xea pode dar uma olhada nest <a href="https://gist.github.com/igoravl/be273447675aad9c797f744a61a6cc5f" target="top">Gist</a>. Ele tem uma fun\xe7\xe3o chamada <code>Resolve-ServerAddress</code> que recebe um FQDN como par\xe2metro e retorna seu IP atual, indicando se ele mudou desde a \xfaltima execu\xe7\xe3o. Em caso positivo, voc\xea poderia por exemplo enviar um email para um administrador avisando da mudan\xe7a, a fim de que ele possa reconfigurar as regras de firewall. Da\xed, basta agendar sua execu\xe7\xe3o (via Agendador de Tarefas do Windows) e pronto! <h2>Passando a r\xe9gua</h2> NuGet \xe9 algo que veio para resolver um monte de problemas no ecossistema .NET - mas, como qualquer mudan\xe7a de paradigma, traz seus pr\xf3prios desafios. Achar o ponto de equil\xedbrio entre a conveni\xeancia desejada pelos desenvolvedores e a seguran\xe7a necess\xe1ria para a infraestrutura da empresa n\xe3o \xe9 f\xe1cil, mas n\xe3o d\xe1 para empurrar com a barriga. Sem resolver esse tipo de quest\xe3o, n\xe3o faz o menor sentido come\xe7ar a discutir DevOps e assuntos correlatos. E a\xed, o que achou? Deixe seus coment\xe1rios! Um abra\xe7o, Igor', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['http://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/NugetSettingsDialog.png'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2017/01/27/como-usar-nuget-sem-escancarar-rede/', 'date': u'2017-01-27 14:23:18', 'slug': u'como-usar-nuget-sem-escancarar-rede', 'title': u'Como usar NuGet sem escancarar a rede?', 'author': u'igoravl', 'taxanomies': {u'category': [u'ALM'], u'post_translations': [u'cabedc4e-73dc-4dc6-9a28-fbd490797383'], u'language': [u'Portugu\xeas']}, 'comments': True, 'wp_id': u'18642', 'type': u'post'}

Vai ser nos dias 31 de mar\xe7o e 01 de abril, na sede da Microsoft em S\xe3o Paulo.</p> <!--more--> <h2>Sobre o DevOps Summit Brasil</h2> <p>Voc\xea conhece o DevOps Summit Brasil? Eis a apresenta\xe7\xe3o do evento, de acordo com o <a href="http://www.devopssummitbrasil.com/">site oficial</a>:</p> <blockquote> <p>O DevOps Summit Brasil \xe9 a fus\xe3o dos consagrados eventos Azure Summit Brasil e ALM Summit Brasil e vem com uma abordagem interdisciplinar para promover um melhor entendimento de nuvem e DevOps. Vivemos um momento de tranforma\xe7\xe3o nos neg\xf3cios, nos departamentos, nas pessoas e na tecnologia. O time to market, a entrega cont\xednua de valor e a redu\xe7\xe3o de custos cada vez mais s\xe3o preocupa\xe7\xf5es da TI. A economia baseada nos servi\xe7os de nuvem, e a entrega cada vez mais \xe1gil, com devops, criam solu\xe7\xf5es inovadoras e requerem menos preocupa\xe7\xe3o com infraestrutura e sistemas operacionais. Pensar fora da caixa \xe9 pensar dentro da nuvem. Venha conhecer mais sobre o Microsoft Azure e Visual Studio Team Services, as solu\xe7\xf5es de cloud e DevOps da Microsoft.</p> </blockquote> <p>S\xe3o dois dias de evento, com uma trilha de neg\xf3cios no primeiro dia (para l\xedderes e gestores que buscam entender os benef\xedcios de DevOps e Cloud Computing para suas empresas) e uma t\xe9cnica no segundo dia, com muito conte\xfado de alto n\xedvel para ajudar profissionais de TI dos mais diversos perfis a adotar pr\xe1ticas \xe1geis e de DevOps, bem como ajudar a levar suas empresas para a nuvem.</p> <p><img src="https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/o-devops-summit-brasil-2017-esta-chegando-voce-esta-prontoIMG_3492.jpg" alt="Eu na edi\xe7\xe3o passada do evento ?"></p> <h2>Minhas palestras</h2> <p>Neste ano irei ministrar duas palestras, uma na trilha de <em>Computa\xe7\xe3o na Nuvem</em> e a outra na de <em>Pr\xe1ticas e Processos</em>. S\xe3o elas:</p> <blockquote> <h3>Provisionando ambientes de dev e teste com Azure DevTest Labs e VSTS</h3> <p>Devs e testers adorariam ter autonomia para provisionar seus pr\xf3prios ambientes. J\xe1 o time de infraestrutura n\xe3o considera nem sequer conversar a respeito, j\xe1 que isso normalmente tem diversas implica\xe7\xf5es pr\xe1ticas. Venha ver como a Azure DevTest Labs (Azure DTL) simplifica o reuso e a defini\xe7\xe3o de pol\xedticas, cotas e limites de uso, a fim de permitir que desenvolvedores possam criar suas VMs sem que isso cause um rombo no or\xe7amento da \xe1rea no fim do m\xeas.</p> <p><strong>Computa\xe7\xe3o na nuvem</strong>. <em>S\xe1bado, 01/abr/2017, <strong>10:00-10:30</strong></em></p> </blockquote> <blockquote> <h3>Projetos \xc1geis, Entrega Cont\xednua e Feature Toggles</h3> <p>Voc\xea sabe como executar de maneira efetiva pr\xe1ticas de entrega cont\xednua e de arquitetura emergente num contexto de desenvolvimento \xe1gil? Uma das pr\xe1ticas que ajudam - e muito! - \xe9 o uso de \'<em>feature toggles</em>\', que permitem ligar e desligar funcionalidades de sua aplica\xe7\xe3o em tempo de release ou em tempo real. Venha aprender a usar feature toggles em projetos .NET integrados ao VSTS usando o LaunchDarkly.</p> <p><strong>Pr\xe1ticas e Processos</strong>. <em>S\xe1bado, 01/abr/2017, <strong>14:50-15:20</strong></em></p> </blockquote> <h2>Inscri\xe7\xf5es e informa\xe7\xf5es</h2> <p>As inscri\xe7\xf5es j\xe1 est\xe3o abertas! <a href="https://www.sympla.com.br/devops-summit-brasil-2017__116205">Garanta seu ingresso agora</a>, pois as vagas s\xe3o limitadas.</p> <p>Ah, e o evento tem descontos para grupos. Para conseguir um desconto para grupos, <a href="mailto:contato@devopssummitbrasil.com?subject=Desconto%20para%20grupos">contate a organiza\xe7\xe3o do evento</a>.</p> <p>Nos vemos l\xe1!</p> <p>Um abra\xe7o,<br> Igor</p>', 'parent': u'0', 'excerpt': '', 'img_srcs': ['https://www.tshooter.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/o-devops-summit-brasil-2017-esta-chegando-voce-esta-prontoIMG_3492.jpg'], 'link': u'http://www.tshooter.com.br/2017/03/09/o-devops-summit-brasil-2017-esta-chegando-voce-esta-pronto/', 'date': u'2017-03-09 12:00:47', 'slug': u'o-devops-summit-brasil-2017-esta-chegando-voce-esta-pronto', 'title': u'O DevOps Summit Brasil 2017 est\xe1 chegando!
